Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Cindywan_707
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. A very convenient location with a walkable distance to many attractives. Restaurants and cafes nearby but not so noisy as mentioned in the reviews, maybe because our room was not facing street. The staff were friendly and helpful. The ambassador cat, Isis, always stay at the hotel lobby to welcome you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and central too.”
Reviews.Author: annhig
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently placed near the St. Michel/Notre Dame RER stop, the hotel was surprisingly quiet, though when we opened the balcony doors, the noise did increase a bit. We booked a deluxe room, which wasn't exactly luxurious but it did mean that we had quite a lot more room than is normal in a Paris hotel room, though this did not extend to the bathroom, which was extremely small. The shower was excellent, which at least partly made up for it. The staff were are friendly as we needed them to be, but we don't ask much of them so they weren't really put to the test. The morning we had breakfast it was good apart from the coffee which was stewed. Whether this was normal I can't say as we only had breakfast on the last day. We slept well and enjoyed the easy access to left and right banks and metro/RER that the hotel gave us, as well as the myriad restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Booking early [6 months in advance] using the hotel website gave us a very good price so that would be a good place to start looking.

Reviews.Title: “Dad's 90th birthday”
Reviews.Author: Eva A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great couple of days in Paris, the hotel was conveniently located, comfortable and practical. The staff we're friendly and helpful all in all a great trip. The walls are very thin and you can hear other rooms and noises but it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week and would gladly return”
Reviews.Author: PearlsMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from March 5-11 and have nothing to say but good things to say. After reading many Paris trip reports and reviews on the website, I was better prepared for the trip. I took earplugs and had a "sleep" playlist on my ipod, but never needed them. I did hear my neighbors when they got a little loud at times, but never constantly. I was in room 505 and being that it was an upper floor, I heard normal street noise. Several nights I even slept with the balcony door open and wasn't bothered. After all, this is a major city so some noise is expected. My friend was in room 305 and she was bothered a bit more by street noise, but she also is from a rural area in the US, so she she's accustomed to quieter surroundings. My bed was comfy, and did not have plastic between the sheet and the mattress. I also packed my own wash cloths, as they were not provided. The hospitality of the staff was great, and I was also prepared to leave my room key at the desk whenever I left, so I took advantage of the in-room safe. I was also able to use the stocked minibar to chill a few sodas and bottled water that I purchased. Most importantly, the value and excellent location are what will have me returning again and recommending this hotel to friends. I booked early and directly with the hotel and got great rates for 2 single rooms. After a night of flying, we opted to take a taxi from CDG to the hotel which cost 65 euros, but on the return the hotel arranged a shuttle with one other hotel stop and the cost was only 32 euros for the two of us. We each bought a caret (10 metro tickets at 12.50, rather than then normal 1.70 per trip), but the metro sharing the same lines with the RER can be a bit confusing, even for someone who spent 10 years taking the metro in Washington, DC. It lacked just enough signage for me to give up, but we were able to take the RER to Tour Eiffel for our appointment to go the top (which I highly recommend as the lines were horrendous), the Invalides, and Musee d'Orsay, as well as the funicular up to Sacre Coeur so it wasn't a total loss. this hotel is so convenient to Notre Dame and the L'Open Bus tours which we used as transportation for the remainder of our trip. Another tip is to consider visiting the Louvre on Friday night when it stays open to 9:45pm. I had heard of crowds there, especially herds of people around the Mona Lisa, but it was much less crowded than I anticipated. Overall, we had a great first visit to Paris and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Some Downsides”
Reviews.Author: Lauric921
Reviews.Content: Having visited Paris many times, I am accustomed to the smallness of the rooms in most three-star hotels. I was excited to try this hotel because of the many rave reviews on this site. I will agree that the location is excellent -- in walking distance of many major sights, and near the St. Michel Metro and RER lines. However, its location in a busy pedestrian area made my street-facing room extremely noisy. The street noise didn't subside till about 2:00 each morning, but was then followed at about 5:30 by delivery trucks, trash pick-up, and construction vehicles. Also, there is little to no soundproofing between rooms. Perhaps if you are a light sleeper it would be best to request a non-street-facing room. My other issue was with the bed. The mattress was covered with a plastic protector, with the bedsheet directly on top of it. This made for a hot, rumply, uncomfortable bed. Weighing the obvious pro of the great location against the cons of the noise and discomfort, I don't think I'd stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Shrt Stay Paris”
Reviews.Author: thesupermum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights at the Europe and will certainly go back. Its location is second to none, five mins from Notre Dame and the Seine (metro and RER Blue from CdeGaul airport). The hotel is between St Germain and the Latin quarter so it is a foody heaven. We managed, on the first night, to find the Irish bar!!! You can get the Batobus (river boat) from Notre Dame but we walked the river round to Eiffle Tower, stopping to see the Musee de Orsay on the way and walked back along the other bank via the Louvre. We didn't have the hotel breakfast but it looked good and was value for money compared to eating out (as we did).

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: SophieEnglandSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel situated in the most inviting part of town, just down the road from notra dame and just steps from the metro station. We paid a little extra for a larger room which had ample space, tv, fridge etc and great views over the quaint side streets. The bathroom was well equipped and I requested a bath which was lovely after cold days in Paris. Reception staff were friendly, although we had no need to call on them other than checking in and out. Cleaning staff did a wonderful job and were very friendly, always saying hello as you passed them. I would most certainly stay here again, it was a brilliant hotel experience and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: cekips
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for over a decade whenever we go to Paris. It has all one needs as well as position, position, position!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Pbakerpurple
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better. 2 minute walk from metro station (same line as Gare Du Nord), 2 minute walk to boulangerie, creperie, restaurants, cafes and only 5 minute walk to Notre Dame. Hotel is in heart of Latin quarter, which comes alive in the evening and a 3 course meal can be found from €11, although we paid €14 for soup, steak & chips, chocolate mouse (delicious!). Hotel itself is clean, with comfortable beds and helpful staff. As previous reviewers have said, it can be noisy in the evening and the dustbin men do come round very early in the morning However, this would be the same in ANY centrally located hotel and is worth the slight inconvienece (I heard the noise the first night but not the second). Would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to wander around an authentic part of Paris where you can just soak up the atmosphere and relax. Will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: benvaesen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worthwile its ranking. Simply because it's on a prime location, center of Paris, service is excellent, rooms are clean. Great value for money!! We stayed three nights and could easily walk the area (Notre Dame, Palais Luxembourg, Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Place des Vosges) but also take the metro to discover some of the other monuments/musea. Great advantage are the restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LO_SD
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the Latin Quarter... You just can't go wrong with the location. The front office staff are very kind and helpful. The whole place is recently remodeled and clean. The only downsides are that they make you leave your key (old skool keys) at the front desk any time you leave the premises. That made us sort of uncomfortable at first, but were quickly at ease when we saw that we really had nothing to worry about with leaving because they were trustworthy and definitely watched over everything. The other thing is that if you are on a budget, this place may not be the best fit for you.... Literally. We got the cheapest room they offered, and it.was.tiny. We got over it, but were shocked at first. Hey, it's Europe, so old, oddly sized rooms and bathrooms are to be expected. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. You're a five-minute walk from Norte Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: theperks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, room was clean and spacious (for a paris hotel room) and had a good shower and corner bath. Only downside on room was a couple of marks on the wallpaper which i guess were suitcase bashes. The hotel location is superb, the restaurants nearby might be a little touristy but there are some nice bars on place St.Michel and excellent local restaurants no more then a 15min walk away. Metro station perhaps 100yards from hotel on the same line as gare d'nord for the eurostar. Great place to explore the city, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Price!”
Reviews.Author: gizellemarie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a weekend with my sister and brother-in-law, and we could not have asked for a nicer stay or a better location. The price for two rooms for three nights was amazing, and the quality of what we got far exceeded my expectations. My single room was cozy, clean and lovely. The bathroom, while small (not an issue, I am one small person and don't need a large bathroom) was impeccably clean and nicely decorated. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The closets are large with shelves and hangers- this may seem trivial, but I thought it was pretty luxurious for a hotel closet. My sister & hubby had a beautiful little balcony with a gorgeous view. The book of recommended restaurants in the lobby is a good resource and we were not led astray by it. It was the perfect hotel for my first trip to Paris and I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan T
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few nights in the hotel and I couldn't be happier. The location is literally the center of Paris, walking distance to most of he great sites and thre is a metro station on the corner. The rental bikes, which is the greatest system ever, is right in front of the Hotel. It is conveniently located in the Latin Quarter which is one of the most charming areas in Paris. The rooms were clean, spacious and well equipped with all of the modern conveniences, for example large screen tv and free wi fi. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. There is also a great restaurant which is part of the Hotel. Great food, great value. I have been coming to Paris for 29 years and this is the only place I will be staying from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good overall value”
Reviews.Author: Litebright2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend, it's in a very good location surrounded by restaurants and cafes, very easy to get to attractions via metro. The hotel is very clean and the staff are pleasant the rooms are small but nice. Good value for money I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SteveTravler
Reviews.Content: What a great location. We stayed a week and loved every minute. So much is so close by:- RER station, Metro, River Seine, shopping up Bd Saint-Michel, dozens of restaurants within 50 meters. Luxembourg gardens and Pantheon a few hundred meters. The hotel was great, at the top of our budget for this trip but location made up for it. Room had double glazed windows, which we had open most of the time and let the atmosphere from outside waft in. Once closed at night it was nice and quiet even though there was still lots of activity on the street. It was on the fourth floor facing the street at the end of the corridor. It was clean and the on the small side, but it is Paris. Room had a minibar and a good closet. We did not try the breakfast but instead went along the street and bought fresh pattisserie for very little, also bought some yoghurt and stored in the minibar. Visit the Pantheon and they have a free tour of the dome. You can go outside and get a fantastic view of Paris. Also visit the plaza in front of Notre Dame at night - what a great atmosphere (Buskers, fire breathers and inline skaters doing incredible runs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room & comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: dasiln
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through venere months in advance and check in was a breeze. The hotel was handy to a numerous metro stations and entrances. We loved the rustic look of the loft style room with decent sized bathroom. We were on Level 6, room 602 - a deluxe double room. The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable (if you like a pretty firm mattress). A few things weren't working - the fridge and the spa bath but didn't bother us. There was no iron/board and the staff were unable to locate one for us. They advertised sound proofed rooms, they are not. We were in a corner room so another room to the right of the bed, street on the left, nothing behind and other room on other side of bathroom. Didn't hear anything from the right room but was a bit annoyed while trying to relax in the bath and hearing everything going on next door. The action on the streets below is noisy but I was prepared and used earplugs so was fine. As for safety we had no issues - but we generally put a Do not Disturb on the door to skip daily services. We had one and no issues. The hotel cat was nice too, lazy around in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to return!”
Reviews.Author: weechooky
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 night stay here in December- staff all very helpful and friendly. Room was really cosy and pretty small (although no smaller than expected for Paris) but for a few nights it's certainly not a problem. We stayed room only and so didn't bother to pay for the breakfast which I think was about €12 each. There was a great wee cafe/bakery (Salon de The I think it was called) within 2 min walk that sold an express breakfast for 2 for €7.90 so we were sold on that! The location of the hotel is great with plenty of great restaurants within easy walking distance. The Metro is also only round the corner. All in all the hotel is great value and seems to be worthy of more than it's 2 stars. We would not hesitate to stay again. The icing on the cake was the adorable Isis the hotel cat!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tommmaxon
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay because of it's location. We flew into Paris and hopped on the RER and got off a half a block from our hotel. We arrived much before the scheduled check in time but they had our room ready and we were able to get a little nap before venturing off into Paris. The service was efficient and friendly. One girl, Jeannine, seemed to be working every day and was very friendly and helpful. They made dinner reservations and gave us directions. The front desk was super. The room was clean and and spacious enough. It was quiet for the most part except for a short while on New Years Eve.....not a problem. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who wanted to be in the middle of Paris and have access to Metro, buses, taxi, or jsut to walk around. So many shops and restaurants and things to see and do within walking distance. Even the Hotel cat was comfortable. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “great location and cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACC1979
Reviews.Content: you can't ask for a better location - even coming from the airport, you can take the RER and it's around the corner from the hotel. There are tons of restaurants around, supermarket, ATM, etc. Notre Dame is just around the corner. I love this location. The room was super cute with old stone walls and wooden beams. The size was decent, especially since this is Paris. nice bathroom, though it was kind of strange that there was no blackout curtain on the bathroom. People can't see in, but a lot of light comes through and there's no door separating it from the bedroom. (the toilet is separate with a door). Our room was on the second floor, i think it was 203. It had a little balcony with a table and chairs for two overlooking the pedestrian-only street below. Really nice. I def think it's worth getting a balcony room. We didn't eat breakfast - it was 12 euro or something ridiculous like that. With so many restaurants around, no need to pay that. Wifi was 5 euro for 2 days and worked fine. i would stay here gain

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel (with some cons to consider)”
Reviews.Author: haysing
Reviews.Content: I give the hotel 4 stars, but my particular room experience 3 stars. I had done a lot of research prior to making my reservation, and I was rather excited at this little find. The location is fabulous! It’s situated on a pedestrian street off Boulevard Saint Michel in the 5th Arrondissement in the excitement of the Latin Quarter/St. Germain on the Left Bank. It’s a bustling area full of cafes and restaurants. The River Seine is a short walk as are many sights: Notre Dame Cathedral, Sorbonne, Pantheon, etc. The hotel staff are polite and accommodating. And they have a special addition to the staff: Isis, a brown tabby cat, whom I was told is “the boss.” She wanders the halls, rides the lift, and greets guests. If you offer, she gladly accepts pets and cheek-rubs. Overall the hotel is quaint, charming, and well-cared for. A good balance of old charm and modern comfort. The following are the reasons my review is not higher. Please note that I’m traveling for an entire month with multiple destinations, so perhaps I’m being much pickier than I would be if I were enjoying a quick holiday then returning home. 1) Room size, 2) Noise, 3) WiFi Accessibility, 4) Breakfast… - Room Size: The rooms pictured on the website are either a select few or there is some trick of depth perception. They did not prepare me for my room (double with balcony on 5th floor), which was very, very tiny—a narrow walkway around the bed granted access to the balcony on one side and the bathroom on the other side. It was crowded for just me and my luggage; I’m glad I’m small and not sharing the space with someone else. - Noise: The website made a point of mentioning that the rooms are sound-proofed. This in particular caught my attention since it's a lively area, and I'm a light-sleeper. But the only things that seem to be sound-proofed are the windows. I heard little street noise, but I heard every sigh, giggle, and bed-frame bump next door, which started within an hour of my check-in and went on intermittently for the next two days. Then each morning vacuuming the hallway began around 9am and random knocking and banging started in from somewhere in the building—remodeling something perhaps? Point is that every noise traveled through the walls from all directions. Of course, this is the nature of an old building, but I don't understand why the hotel emphasizes sound-proofing when it’s not really a strength. - WiFi Accessibility - Every place I've stayed (every place in every city!) offers free wifi access for their guests. This hotel charges for the wifi. I believe it's 3 euros for 24 hours and then "deals" if you request longer time--I got one week for 10 euros. But when I went to connect, I discovered that the charge is "per access point," meaning I had wifi on my computer, but if I wanted to also be able to use it on my iPhone, I had to pay another 10 euros. Ridiculous! - Breakfast - I've grown quite spoiled by gourmet breakfasts being included in the stay at other places that I was rather disappointed to discover that the breakfast here is 12 euros, and yet includes only "continental" items--pastries, juice, etc. Based on the size and noise in my particular room and the add-ons, I think it was overpriced. Depending on the importance of these four things to you, this is a charming place to stay in a great part of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: travel_pair24
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is right in the centre of everything-this is it! The room is very tastefully decorated and clean and with a huge closet. The staff are very helpful and friendly and it is only two mins walk to St Michel station with the Metro and RER and Notre Dame Cathedral is just across the Seine. There are over a hundred restaurants within 100m so eating out has many options and also Velib bikes right at the front door. Our room had a lovely little balcony over looking the street-Room 203 is right at the front and a great choice. The price is quite reasonable for Paris and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Elissa358
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this fab hotel a month ago and I couldn't fault it for the price. As I was arriving in Paris at 9am after an overnight train, I confirmed with the hotel that there was somewhere I could leave my luggage prior to check-in. When I arrived, exhausted and in desperate need of a shower and a lie down, the receptionist checked with housekeeping and informed me my room would be ready at 10.30am. After a great buffet breakfast, I was in my room, unpacking and recovering by 10am. Amazing! The service and care amongst all of the staff I met was fantastic. The room was a little small but for one person it was the perfect size. I booked the cheapest available so I am sure the other rooms are more spacious. The furnishings and bathroom were new and comfortable and the room itself was quiet with a lovely view to boot. I would definitely recommend this little gem of a place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tlynn63
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europe St. Severin is off of a main street and easity assessable to many of Paris' attractions. It is only a few doors down from the hustle and bustle of many many restaurants in the Latin Quarter. The room was much smaller than I think I have ever experienced but there was a huge closet and the room was clean. After only checking in the desk clerk always called us by name. We were given an upgrade to a balcony and that really made it for us! It was fun sitting on the balcony in the chilly night air looking down on the activity of the street. I would definitely recommend this hotel to the budget minded--but get a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, good value”
Reviews.Author: rs695
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other hotels in Paris, this is as good as it gets for the money. As many other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small--as they are in nearly every other hotel in Paris--but otherwise well appointed, clean and comfortable. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Wifi is extra but reasonably priced at 5 euros per 48 hrs. The location can't be beat: For those who don't mind a bit of walking, nearly all the big sights in Paris are within a 20-30 minute stroll; for those who don't, the Saint Michel RER and Metro stations are just a couple of blocks away. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Kurt F
Reviews.Content: Found on trip Advisor and it was best choice we could make. Central to all of Paris - conveninet to metro, sites, cafes, ATM, ebven a Starbucks around the corner etc, Staff was great- room we had was deluxe double on 6th floor - great views! Quiet! Roomy!Great shower. Staff was joy to deal with, had a breakfest buffet that worked perfectly for us. Hotel cat was a doll as well! Biggest surprise: the italian restaurant - RIM- in the hotel is GREAT! Try it! Hotel was helpful in arranging reservation at restaurants, shuttle services etc. The city is beautiful, the people wonderful, and Hotel Europe Saint Severin just made it all better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELHUBRIS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europe St. Severin is a wonderful, authentic budget conscious accommodation. Minutes away from Nortre Dame and the Cluny museum, the hotel is just steps from the St. Michel Metro Station. The location makes it convenient to travel to all the top attractions. The rooms are spacious by European standards and have everything you need: comfortable bed, excellent updated shower and tub, mini bar (which you can use to refrigerate your own culinary treasures) hair dryer, Wifi at a nominal cost and a lovely balcony overlooking the quaint street. There is a restaurant attached to the property that I did not try but it looked okay. The small lobby area is managed by Isis the cat who sleeps and purrs on the velvety red chairs. The staff is helpful and pleasant without being overly effusive. I would recommend this hotel. Note: Avoid the restaurants in this area: They are tourist traps. A short walk will lead you to some excellent choices such as La Tournebievre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: unfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here as I was unable to get a room in a neighbouring hotel where I normally stay. I got a promotional price of 99 euros because I booked early, saving 60 euros. The reception area is cosy and quaint, and opens directly into the breakfast area and adjoining italian restaurant. The room was a fair size, and the bathroom was small but functional, fitting in a WC, wash basin and a shower unit. There was a large flat screen TV with a wide variety of international cable channels provided. Wifi was not free but the fee of 3E for a day is OK. However, the user code and password generated for wifi can only be used for one device eg either your iphone or ipad or laptop, not all three, and I didn't ask if I would have to pay 9E if I wanted wifi for all three devices. My room came with a small balcony with a table and chairs, so it was great to be able to sit 5 storeys up and people watch the bustling activity in the latin quarter below. The location is simply amazing. The RER B is just round the corner (St Michel station) which gets you door to door to CDG and Orly airports, the RER C also serves the stop which gets you directly to the Musee d'Orsay and Eiffel tower. Breakfast is charged at an additional 13 euros. It is a buffet, and the description in the lift says that in addition to the cold buffet of breads, danishes, cold cuts and cereals, a hot breakfast eg omelette could be provided on request. There are no hot items on the buffet, so i asked the nice waitress if I could have an omelette with ham and this was duly cooked fresh for me, which was nice. So I think 13 euros is quite good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gloria H
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to find that our hotel room on the second floor had a small balcony with table and chairs, overlooking the street below. The room also had a good size flat screen TV, minibar and safe. The bathroom had a big corner bath with a powerful shower attachment, and although small,the room was clean - and excellent for a 2 star hotel. Great location, in the heart of the Latin quarter and just a couple of minutes from the metro and bus service. Friendly staff and the only slight downside was quite a bit of noise at night, but this is to be expected if you choose this bustling area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfied”
Reviews.Author: DAP05
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here as a solo traveler. The location was awesome and immediate area in a touristy locale. Steps from metro, bus, and RER. Easily walked to Notre Dame and St Chapelle. Wifi cost was affordable at 5 euros for 48 hrs. Room was charming and clean with balcony. Dominic at the front desk was especially helpful. I did not try the breakfast and instead ate at other places in the area. I would choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient, charming, great value”
Reviews.Author: AllGoodGifts
Reviews.Content: I got an unbelievable price for a room here from Travelocity. The location is very convenient - less than a five-minute walk from the RER B line from the airport and the Metro, less than a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, and right in the heart of a bunch of restaurants and cafes. The front-desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I had a room on the fifth floor with a little balcony and a cafe table and chairs - very charming! The rooms are small and not luxurious, but I paid a good bit more for a less-convenient hotel later in the trip and the room was no better (and lacked the cute balcony). The interior walls are probably a little thin - you could sometimes hear people in the adjoining rooms - but the noise from the street was never a problem, and overall I had no issues. The internet access is not free, but it cost something like 3 Euro for one day, which I had no problem paying. Personally, I loved the place, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a high-value hotel in an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “HIgh points for helpful, friendly staff and small, but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: luxusreal
Reviews.Content: It's Paris after all and rooms are small, but location and staff are 4 stars. If you want an active and convenient neighborhood in the Latin Quarter, this hotel is perfect! Well run by a friendly and helpful staff, you walk out the door to find yourself in the middle of restaurants, sightseeing, metro lines and steps from the Seine. We were very pleased with the service and cleanliness and would stay here again! Susan

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trionichide
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is nice and confortable. Our room was clean and nicely furnished, although a little bit dark, being at the first floor. The staff is helpful and polite. Above all, the location is nearly perfect for anything to do in Paris, being exactly above the Saint Michel / Notre Dame metro and RER station, with direct connections to both airports and many other places of interest. Unique spot is the lack of a wireless service in the rooms, although I've read comments by the owner that they are trying to improve the internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twoadultsthreekids_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to Metro, great little restaurants and cafes. Extremely helpful, friendly staff (not to mention Isis the cat)! The room was quirky, rustic and very charming. We travelled as a couple with our teenage daughter and would recommend this hotel to any age group wanting safe city centre location. Great area to eat out breakfast, lunch and evening meals. We would particularly recommend a cafe called Boulangerie Artisanale for pastries, coffees etc. All in all a perfect hotel in a perfect city!!!

Reviews.Title: “What Air Conditioning??”
Reviews.Author: lrdecker1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is covenient to attractions, the metro, etc. Also convenient to many good and cheap restaurants (we liked Le Bourbon, the Hotel's restaurant and Marathon) but this proximity makes the area noisy in the evenings. The hotel has an elevator and our room was clean and moderately sized (which is relatively large by French standards). Everything worked well for us EXCEPT FOR THE AC (and we overheard other guests also complaining about the AC) and every time we talked to hotel personnel about the AC problem we got a completely different explanation/excuse. The bottom line, however, is that the AC is incapable of keeping the rooms comfortably cool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: roddy_77
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but that was to be expected in Paris. The holel was very clean and tidy and the rooms were boutique in style with rustic stone walls and renovated bathrooms. Fantastic location - could not have gotten any better position. In a pedestrian only section of Saint Michel. Beautiful restaurants and cafes surround the base of the hotel as well. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - run down room, poor ammenities”
Reviews.Author: MinceLikesElves
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. This was overshadowed by the condition of the room - it was dusty, the shower floor was sticky and unclean, and the airconditioning did not cool. Our room was small and noisy from the street below. We intentionally left the "do not disturb" sign on our door when we left our room because we did not want our belongings to be touched. However, we returned to the hotel to find that it had been made up and upon speaking to reception the matter we did not even receive an apology. Do not stay here if you want to use the internet. The Wifi is slow, overpriced (should be free - we are not in the 1990s!!), and difficult to connect to. And it will disconnect you after 30 mins to an hour. This was one of our final hotels in our 10 week trip around europe and was definitely the most disappointing - there is better value elsewhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, GREAT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: Taras P
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. It is literally steps from 'Sortie 2' of the St. Michel Metro station. We stayed in a double deluxe room and it was a very nice, adequately sized room. The only little hitch we had was that our shower was not draining, but once that was fixed, everything was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: mrstj06
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Paris and we were set on staying in the Latin Quarter this time since we loved it so much last time. We couldn't have picked a better location. This hotel is right in the heart of the Latin Quarter, literally steps away from the Metro. Notre-Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens are only a short walk away. The rooms are tiny (but that's Paris) but they are very nicely decorated and cozy. Our room had a lovely window that overlooked the outside street. If you are looking for a well-priced, comfortable hotel in a great location...this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cosy hotel with real french atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: RasaPr
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the hotel this august. It was my first time in Paris and I could not imagine better location for my first visit: very easy to keep on track it in the labirynth of small streets and it is in a walking distance from all main attractions. The staf is very friendly and the atmosphere is cosy, home like. Breakfast: if you like just your croissant and coffe for breakfast, skip the breakfast at the hotel and walk to one of many boulangeries around. The breakfast at the hotel costs 10Eur (croissant + coffe at boulangerie approx. 2-3Eur), but if you like your breakfast bigger it's worth to consider breakfast at the hotel as at the cafes around for french breakfast you will pay the same 10Eur. We definetly will go back to the hotel if travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Kjmama
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a first time trip to Paris. The location is near public transportation, easy walk to sights - Notre Dame, Lourve; good area for people watching and affordable dining. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the room was clean with a view to the streets below.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valch0u
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect! The price was not too high, the place is amazing, the room and bathroom was clean, we had enough room for three people. I really don't have anything negative to say about this hotel. The service could be a little bit more sympathetic, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Latin Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: kaycee2117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europe Saint Severin at the end of August 2011. We arrived in the late evening via metro so we had a bit of trouble finding the hotel. It is super close to Saint Michel station but we were a bit lost finding the correct street. Street names are located on the side of buildings.The hotel is located in the heart of Latin Quarter, surrounded by wonderful restaurants, cafes and shops and there were people everywhere. The room is fairly small but clean and decent, but that is pretty common for Paris hotels. Despite the hustle bustle downstairs, the room is quiet and we weren't disturbed at all. We had breakfast every morning at Papa Boulangerie - a bakery just around the corner from the hotel. They had fresh croissants and other pastries.. so yummy! The hotel is steps away from Notre Dame Cathedral and a 20 min walk to the Louvre. We walked everywhere - the location is unbeatable. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful . Only cons for this hotel is the small size rooms, the bed wasn't the most comfortable and the fact that the safe box is not bolted to the cupboard. They aren't any amenities either such as a gym or pool. Other than that, we highly recommend this hotel and won't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MissSoCal
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident - I am so glad we did! The staff was warm, friendly and so helpful! We checked in late and the gentleman at the desk made it as easy as possible, he even upgrades us for free. The room was lovely and had a great bistro set on a balcony overlooking the Latin Quarter. It is conveniently located to Notre Dame, the metro and La Seine that runs parallel to the Louvre, Champs Elysees and eventually the Eiffel Tower. A chic place to stay in Paris. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay :-)”
Reviews.Author: Divers2go
Reviews.Content: Hotel was rated 2 stars, I think it could be 3. Location is really accessible with all sorts (metro, RER, taxi, etx.) . Hotel is in the heart of Latin Quarter, a cozy place in Paris, with nice restaurants surrounding it. We stayed 3 nights/4 days here. The room was nice , a little bit small for a double (we booked a double room with balcony), should've booked a double deluxe instead bcoz they said its bigger , but anyways, everything we need in a room was there, safe box, mini bar, nice TV, telephone, wifi, and the bathrooms were cleaned everyday and replenished with amenities. We didnt hear a thing from outside, with all the traffics and restaurants, its good islolation they have with their window. But you could hear your neighbors ,I mean the door slamming . But it was ok. Only thing is every morning doors started slamming at 7 or 8 am, and not good for us who wakes up late . But still its ok . The receptionists were helpful and can speak english .. Will definitely go back here next time. But will book a deluxe double room instead with balcony, its the same price anyway ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: robertsfamilytx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the last week of August and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My room was nice and the bed was comfortable. It is also less than half a block from the Metro/RER station so getting around was a breeze. In fact, the RER line that connects to CDG stops there as well which made it very convenient. The hotel wireless connections were a bit slow but passable. The hotel is in the Latin Quarter and there are dozens of cafes within feet of the front door. Notre Dame is only a couple of blocks as well. I was a bit concerned that the street noise would be a problem, but the room was quiet enough. One suggestion is to ask for the room upgrade. I was given room 203 which had a great balcony where you can sit, people watch and enjoy a bottle of wine. If you can get that room, you will not be disappointed with the view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standard of accommodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Marco10
Reviews.Content: Excellent standard of hotel accommodation in a good location. Worth the additional expense for a balcony room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central and customer-friendly!”
Reviews.Author: AshishChennai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked at the hotel on the recommendation of a friend. We booked on their website and received an excellent deal for the Deluxe Rooms (corner rooms ending in 01 numerals!). We emailed the hotel just before we left home, and they replied promptly reconfirming our reservation. The Deluxe Rooms are the ones to book if you are staying here. We peeked at the other rooms and they did look a bit cramped. Our room had a lovely king-bed, big windows facing the street, a private toilet, and a wash-basin and giant jacuzzi discreetly tucked away in a corner. This is a room for couples. And don't let the washbasin and bath in the same room put you off. It actually adds to the aesthetics. Our room was huge, there was original stone and timber beams on one wall, and plenty of storage. Being centrally located right in the middle of the Latin Quarter meant that restaurant and street busker music filtered through the windows, as did the early morning garbage trucks. But being Indians and used to sound pollution in our cities, we actually felt quite at home and slept quite soundly! The service at the front desk was friendly, and Jamal, the night-duty manager, was very helpful, especially when figuring out how to open the tricky room lock as well as with directions, and an adaptor plug. The hotel is in the heart of the touristy restaurant district, and so you are spoilt for choice among an array of very average restaurants. There was a Lebanese restaurant that was great value. We skipped breakfast at the hotel and pampered ourselves at the closest Eric Kayser boulangerie, a favourite among Parisians. We walked to almost all the major sights - 10mins to Notre Dame, 15mins to the Ponte De Neuf and Louvre, and 5mins to the nearest metro. Perfect! We would not hesitate to book here again and highly recommend it for couples looking for a centrally located hotel in Paris, expecting a clean spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs up....Best place to stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1luvtotravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is considered a 2* but it is much more than that. First of all the hotel is charming, the rooms are great, beds & bathroom are excellent, also very near both the RER and the Metro (super important in order to see Paris conveniently.) The Latin Qtr., talk about being in the center of everything, we'd go sightseeing in the daytime and at night we'd walk out of the hotel and had so many restaurants to choose from the streets of the Latin Qtr. were sizzling with locals,tourist and street entertainment, it's a fabulous place to stay and great for shopping, lots of shops both of tourist items and regular clothing & shoes just blocks from the hotel. The staff at the reception were super friendly & helpful, gave us a little map to the nearby grocery stores so we could get our son some milk & some snacks, and who can forget the hotel cat she is great, right away she becomes familiar with those staying at the hotel, if you dont like cats dont worry she doesnt come up to you she's usually just relaxing on of the hotel lobby sofa's or chairs. Book directly with the hotel, you'll get a much better deal, we did. We had requested a quiet room & that's exactly what we got, room 512 (triple) perfect size for our family and our 3 huge luggages. Internet was super cheap for Europe standards I think it was 5 Euros for 48 hours or something like that, great to stay connected with those at home. Turning in your key when you leave and picking it up when you return is not a big deal actually his is very common in Europe, it was like this in most of our hotel's during our stay in Italy. We will definitely return to this hotel when we return to Paris, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a good hotel with a great location without having to break the bank. It is a true gem in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, very friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: data_wrangler_nyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for four nights, and it was the highlight of our trip. We got there in the wake of some confusion with other hotels, and the desk staff was extremely nice and very helpful -- they let us change our reservation from one bed to two beds, and let us check into the room early. For the rest of our stay, they were always bright and cheerful and super helpful when we had questions. The room was spacious and clean with a big window and a balcony ledge, all the furniture seemed pretty new and well-kept-up. Beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a little cramped, but that's all I can say bad about it. We actually spent some time hanging out in the room and it didn't feel cramped or stuffy at all, which wasn't the case with some other hotel rooms we stayed in. The location of this place could not be better. It's spitting distance from the Seine and Notre Dame, the Blvd St Michel metro stop which has numerous trains, and an easy walk to all kinds of great things in St Germain and île de la Cité. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 2star!!”
Reviews.Author: joylin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only rated a 2 * and in my opinion should be higher. We had 4 nights here and loved the location. The hotel staff were very friendly and our room was kept very clean. There is no kettle in the room but you can purchase a lovely cup of coffee from the breakfast room. Our room 405 was facing the front and i thought it would be very noisy but when we closed our windows at night we could hear nothing:) We are planning to go back to Paris next year and this will be our hotel of choice. The restaurant is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Sflloyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris with my boyfriend, we were not going to do a hostel because it's Paris! So I started looking at hotels. I came across hotel Europe because of the reviews on trip advisor. This hotel is in such a good location, just off the main st ( rue st Michel) which 100 busses frequent, this makes getting around so easy. Also within the same block of the hotel there is an abundance of international hotels & bars so there is definitely atmosphere of a night time. Some people may think it's to busy but we are in our 20's so it was perfect for us. Shopping is just along the main st, so ladies definitely push for this hotel... While my boyfriend had a nap one day after a long day of shopping on the champs élysées I snuck out to do some more and grab a coffee. The staff speak perfect English which was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel because it's such a good location and the hotel was so lovely... Price was also great...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: blinkentrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 5th floor in a room with a small balcony overloking the bustling street. The balcony was great, with a small table and two chairs, allowing one to have a glass of wine with cheese while watching the people in the street below. The room was furnished beautifully and kept very clean. No real noise from the streets with the windows closed. Important: the breakfast weighs in at 12 euro per person and they don't really tell you this. But: the breakfast is excellent, with fresh baguette, bread, pain au chocolat, juices, and a vast array of fruit jams. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Perfect location, great room.”
Reviews.Author: JulianaGouveia
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel for tourists getting to know Paris, looking for easy access to public transportation, restaurants, cafes, and walking-distance activities and facilities in general. It´s right in the heart of Paris. The room was relatively large for Parisian standards, had charming decor, was clean and well kept and the shower was also good. To sum it up: this place offers great value for your money. I would definitely stay at Hotel Europe Saint Severin again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: anabee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Very close to a lot of transport options and food options. Infact just under the hotel and around it were heaps of tables set outdoors and many many restaurants packed with diners. There were also many hotels around this area. The rooms were a fair size. We did have problems with the refridgerator (not cooling) and air conditioner (dripping). Both reported, nothing done. The female receptionists were lovely, always smiling and helpful. The room keys took some getting used to, even had to help another guest as she struggled trying to get into her room. Notre Dame Cathedral is barely 5 mins away and we loved that we could see it everytime we went out somewhere. The boat cruise from under Pont Neuf was also walking distance, about 10 mins and we enjoyed the Paris by night cruise. It was a very lively area and the hotel felt safe. Speaking of safe, they do have safes in the room but they are not fixed. Just lying about in the cupboard. Internet station near the reception was 3 Euros for 24 hours. But their keyboard was way different than what we are used to so spent a lot of time sending off one email as was searching for keys and alt, tab, etc. All in all, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a FABULOUS Location!”
Reviews.Author: EleesPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem! Located in the Latin Qtr (Saint Germain), the hotel is surrounded by wonderful cobblestone steets filled with restaurants, shops & bars. The metro (underground) & RER (train) is extremely close by (Saint Michel Notre Dame the closest stop). This means you can get a train directly from both Paris CDG or Paris Orly on RER B. The train also goes directly to Versailles which is a must. The rooms were small but comfortable and very cute, a tad on the small side though (but what do expect from Paris). Overall a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1104
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just adorable. Everything about it was exactly what we were looking for for our first trip to Paris. Close to everything, Metro right outside the door, in the main part of the city where there is lots of action. We must have looked at 50 hotels on trip advisor before we chose this one (although it WAS the first one we looked at as well, so we could have saved ourselves the time :-)) The hotel is right on a busy street in the heart of the latin quarter. Pro: easy to find restaurants, wine, pastries, shopping, there is an easy-bike rental right outside, you just put your card in and pay something like $2.00 for a half hour bike rental. Con: this meant there was noise from the street as businesses got their morning deliveries and at night when the bars were closing. I didn't notice much of this noise, but I live in the city and am used to it. if you want total peace and tranquillity or are a very light sleeper this might not be your spot. There is a concierge 24/7 and all were very kind and helpful and spoke english. The room was cute and clean and the housekeeping service kept the room nice. Our bathroom looked recently remodeled and was very nice, although the shower was typically european (read: small!). We paid a bit extra to have a balcony, and it was well worth it, I liked sitting on the balcony watching people on the street with a bottle of wine at the end of the day. There was a fridge but it was only for the mini bar items, which was inconvenient because it would have been nice to have some snacks on hand after a long day. I didn't check the minibar prices, but i just automatically assume they are ridiculous. There was also a safe in our room. Bottom line, this hotel was more then I expected for something with a 2 star rating. The price was on the high end of moderate but was on par with other hotels we looked at in the area. We would certianly stay here again. One small caveat about the neighborhood is that it IS a touristy area, so some of the restaurants are blah to yuck. Ask the concierge for recommendations for good places. He recommended one for us that looked AMAZING. Sadly we were too late and they were totally booked, but be sure to ask!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dsilsby
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Paris hotels over the years, I know that it's a bit of a gamble. At the Hotel Europe St. Severin we came up winners. The location is fantastic with a wealth of restuarants, bars etc within spitting distance. Easy access to public transport etc. Rooms were clean and very functional, with fully working AC, TV's and showers with plenty of hot water. The staff were realy friendly and helpful, despite previous reviews, and they all spoke very good english (even tolerating our attempts at French). We stayed as a family group and had 2 twins, 2 doubles and single room. For central Paris I found it to be be great value. I will defintely go straight back here on my next visit to Paris. No more Hotel roullette required!! P.S. If coming in from Gare du Nord then catch the number 38 bus to St. Michel....it takes you bout 20 metere from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would never come back here”
Reviews.Author: NTE1105
Reviews.Content: We did not have a great experience at this hotel. The location is great, however the service, room size, and affordability don't measure up to anything they advertise. The reception/lobby area is not friendly and they just want you out of their hair as soon as possible. The room is tiny and the bathroom is even smaller. It was nice to be central in the Latin Quarter, however I would find a different hotel in this area as this was not worth the money we paid at all. it was the most expensive hotel of our European travels (Italy & Spain) and the smallest room we had out of the three countries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladiesel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Paris part of our European Holiday. This is a very nice boutique style hotel in a great location, right smack in the middle of cafes, restaurants and shops galore! It is within walking distance to the Notre Dame Cathedral, Louvre Museum and Seine River Cruise starting point. We were a group of 5, so we booked a triple and double room. The rooms were a bit small, but it was just right for us. Our room had cobblestone wall which gave it an urban feel to it. It was also very clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were a good enough size and was also sparkling clean. The safe in the room was a little too small, we couldn't fit our laptop in it. Front desk people were very helpful and always provided us w/ directions whenever we asked. They even directed us to a self service laundry and that helped us save quite a bit considering the size of our group. One thing I would've liked was a room with a view. I asked upon check in, but unfortunately, they were all booked and the room we got had a terrace type balcony instead. It was okay, but again, it would have been nice to enjoy a view of Paris from our room. I will definitely make sure to request this in advance when we come back to Paris. Oh there was also an added bonus, if you're a cat lover like me, we got to meet the hotel cat Isis...she was a cutie! The hotel does offer wi-fi which isn't free but it's a deal at only 5 euros for 3 days. Cheapest wi-fi we found in Europe. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will book again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with bustling activity on yr doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Dibdurch
Reviews.Content: Booked thru lastminute.com so got fab room with roof top views of paris for half the price-yay! Amazing location, close to everywhere and we cud see notre dame from our window. Quatre latin IS v touristy but we enjoyed meandering around for a couple of easy days. Receptionist spoke excellent english and couldn't have been more helpful. Check out pho 67 for fab vietnamese food nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: LinnyUKNZ
Reviews.Content: The location is great, very central and on a mainly pedestrian street, however it is a little like tourist central, because of the number of eateries which have taken over the area. I've stayed at this hotel at least four other times over the last ten years, and I can say that I will not stay again unless they make improvements in the facilities they provide to guests, or if they reduce how much they are charging. The prices have increased over the years, but the quality of the hotel itself hasn't. The hotel is nice enough, pleasant decor and so on, but there is a lack of basic facilities; like tea and coffee facilities in the room (3 euros to purchase), there's no iron or ironing board in the hotel for guests to use if they need to (it went "missing" some time ago apparently). These basic things, are things that people expect to have available, when paying a decent amount of money to stay in a hotel. It was our wedding anniversary, and we hadn't been back to Paris for a couple of years, so we splashed out on their "Superior Double Room with Balcony" at 150 euros per night. There was nothing superior about the bathroom which was a shoe box and was a bit dated. They may have redecorated the bedroom areas a while ago, but the bathroom just had modern / newish accessories and things like the shower door didn't open or close easily… I could go on, but I won't. Essentially we won't be staying again, because there is more to be had for your money, at other hotel establishments. Not a Superior experience, for the Superior price charged!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the location”
Reviews.Author: Mares22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europe St Severin in end of June and absolutly loved it. THe hotel is much nicer than a two star although it doesn't have many amenities. Our room was excellent and spacious and the view from the room was great. The room was spacious enough for us (2 adults and 2 yr old that had a cot). The bathroom is very nice and is a good size. The location of this hotel in my opinion couldn't be beat. In the heart of the Latin Quarter, surrounded by cafes, resturants, small shops. Very Safe and everything is open late so you can walk around until early hours of the morning. Would definetely recommend this hotel, the only comment is don't get the breakfast, main great places to try around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, poor service, great location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSusie
Reviews.Content: We booked with th St. Severin as per a recommendation of a friend and the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were delighted when we arrived as the location was tucked away in a walking neighborhood filled with restaurants and shops. When we arrived, we found the room very small, even for European standards. We tripped over each other while we stayed there. The bathroom was even smaller. There was one small shelf, that barely held my lotion, toothpaste and toothbrush. I put my bathroom supplies, make up on the stand in front of the TV, as there was no other location to put it. There was only one towel rack, so we had to use the only chair in the room to dry the second towel. The shower was a regular-size, but the drain cover kept getting kicked around due to it's location and the fact that it was not adhered to the drain. I was worried I would trip on it. The hotel website said that they has a blowdryer in the room, so I left mine at home. The blowdryer was more like a hair burner. I can blow a better amount of air with my mouth and the dryer was too hot and seemed to burn my hair before it dried it! It also turnd off after 2-3 minutes and then would cool down about 7 minutes. It took 4 rounds to dry my sholder height hair, as it looked horrible due to the fact it dried on it's own and was overheated and became "fly away" hair that looked unconditioned. There was no space other than a closet with 6 hangers to put your clothing. There were 3 shelves, approximately 5 inched deep for clothing and one luggage/suitcase holder. We ended up not unpacking, but leaving our clothing in our suitcases. One of us used the suitcase holder for our luggage and the other used the foot stool (why they have it with so little room, who knows!) so that we could free up the small table for our computer. For the price, we had expected more. The room would have been fine for one person, but we were two and had booked a double room. We would not stay there again. We had a few questions for the staff, but they were unfriendly and not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: hachii
Reviews.Content: I have spent the last few nights at Hotel Europe Saint Severin. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. My room is tastefully decorated (perhaps recently refurbished), it is clean, there is good air conditioning, a very comfortable bed, and there is a lovely sunny balcony overlooking the street below. It is also very central - 2 minutes from St Michel metro station, 3 minutes from Notre Dame, and a rack of the fabulous Paris Valibo bikes outside. So it is very easy to get around. The staff have been very friendly, including tolerating me while I try to speak French (despite them all speaking perfect English). My room is compact, but plenty of room to move around, and plenty of room for a single room. I did see into another double (?) room, and it was very spacious. I don't think there is room service, but there are plenty of cafes within 1 min of the hotel. Wifi is €5 for 2 days. I will be telling my friends and family to stay here if they come to France.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Walsung
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Europe Saint Severin and really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel is located in a great location for visiting the primary sites of Paris. It is a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and Saint Chapelle. The St. Michel Metro stop is barely a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We arrived from CDG on the RER St. Michel stop and had a quick walk to the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and a very nice Boulangerie around the corner from the hotel. The area is busy in the evenings, but the street noise was not a problem from our room. We though the location was great. Our room was on the 6th floor (#602), and had a large and new bathroom with a jetted tub. The room had exposed timber beams, stone/brick walls, and dormer windows with views over the Latin Quarter. The bed was comfortable with crisp and clean linens. The room was very comfortable and atmospheric. Our friends were staying in the room next to ours (#601) with views of Notre Dame. Unfortunately, there were problems with their air conditioning not working during their stay. Their room was very hot, and never got fixed the 3 nights they were there, even though the problem was reported as soon as they checked in. All in all, we had a very positive experience with the hotel, and will stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Tyrolia-Joe
Reviews.Content: OK, we liked this hotel. It's our first visit to Paris and we would definitely go back and we'd stay here again. The Hotel is a five minute walk from the metro stop at Notre Dame. It's in the heart (I think) of the Latin Quarter and in the middle of a lively section of Paris. The hotel seems to have ticked all the boxes for us. It was reasonably priced.. for Paris. The staff was friendly and it was well taken care of and clean. Right outside the door is a bike rental station and tons of eateries of all flavours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CHaskin
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with 3 single beds. The room was large, clean, and very attractive. We were in the heart of the Latin Quarter and enjoyed walking the streets and visiting the many different cafes. We were within walking distance of Notre Dame, and catching a boat ride down the river Seine. The receptionist spoke English and gave us many helpful hints. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,room smaller than a hole,impolite reception”
Reviews.Author: Tassos75
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect,only 2 minutes from the Seine and the metro. the room on the fifth floor was supposed to be a...superior double room with a balcony.however,is is about 10m2, you can hardly move inside and the toilette will not fit you if you are more than e.g. 100 kg. i wonder if this room is a superior one, how the standard double room is...taking a look at the evacuation plan, we realised that it was one of the smallest on that floor. the balcony does not have chairs and table, as shown in the photos on the web site. the room's decoration and walls are not in very good condition. the wi-fi mentioned on the web site is not for free. the breakfast is poor and too expensive (double price), in comparison to the breakfast we found outdoors, and hardly any guest prefers it. one of the 3 ladies we met in the reception was absolutely impolite and rude. she never said goodmorning or goodevening, she never raised her head while speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a few things to note”
Reviews.Author: Lamby80
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and overall we were very happy with it. Having not been to Paris before, we were advised to stay in the Latin Quarter so that we would be central to everything. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to the river, the metro is literally around the corner. However, we found the area to be too touristy for us and if we went back would try and stay in the St Germain area, depending on the cost. The hotel itself is quite small, which we prefer and the staff on reception very friendly. We requested a high floor and did get this. We booked a superior double with balcony which according to the hotel website picture, has a small table and chairs to use but ours did not. We asked at reception and were told that this was because of health and safety. If you aren't going to provide them, dont advertise them! If i had known this, i would not have bothered booking this room and saved some money - pointless paying for something that you cannot really use. Also, the safe in the room is not locked down and could actually just be moved and taken out of the cabinet - again, defeating the object of having a safe! Would i stay there again if i ever visited Paris? Yes, as it is good value for money but i wouldnt pay for a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sian99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2011 and had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location and it was very easy to get here from the airport by train. We had a corner room overlooking the little square, it was very clean and done in a nice style with stone walls. It was freezing outside but the room was lovely and warm and very comfortable. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. We walked almost everywhere and only used the metro a couple of times as the hotel is in such a good location. There are a lot of restaurants nearby and although we avoided the ones very close (due to restaurant staff outside trying to drag you in!), we ate in a lovely restaurant with a view of the Notre Dame one night. The second night we went on a river cruise with dinner, which I can highly recommend. Fab hotel, great location and would stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent: location, bed linen, room, staff - pricey but that's Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kanaschwiiz
Reviews.Content: at the intersection of multiple RER lines and many good Paris sights, this hotel pleasantly surprised us with a (relative for Paris) big, quiet room with good bed linens. We got a 3-bed room which was ideal with small child. Cat in lobby. Good shower pressure. Air conditioning/temperature control worked well. My wife will want to stay here again. Beds were not bad but not top. Hard to find much else to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mia427
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I was nervous about traveling to Paris alone without speaking French, but this place made it easy. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and all spoke English. The rooms were a little on the small side, but they would be fine for any solo traveler or couple. It was very clean, and the bathroom was well kept. It was especially good for the price. It is in a nice location (very close to Notre Dame and the Seine River). I made a friend who was staying in a different hotel for only a little less, and this hotel was way nicer and in a much better area. I didn't spend much time in my room, but it was comfortable. Highly recommended and I definitely plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you prefer to not wake up at 6:30am every morning!”
Reviews.Author: Tintinsfreundin
Reviews.Content: + The location is pretty good + The room was nice furnished + The bathroom was also stylish + Fridge & Safety existent + Dark enough in the room to sleep + Aircondition + Possible to rent a bike down on the street + Close to RER - easy to reach Paris CDG + Within walking distance to Louvre, Notre Dam, Les Halles etc + The staff in the reception were friendly - We woke up 6:30am every morning because they were cleaning the street & picking up rubbish every morning on the street ---> that was VERY loud and annoying - very expensive breakfast --> should be included in the price for the room 153€ per night - very loud in the evening as all the pubs/restaurants had guests until 1am outside - no soundproofed rooms, possible to hear other guests from other rooms As I normally just spend time in the room at night I would prefer that it would not be so loud. As sleep is the most important thing in a hotel room. So don't pick this hotel if you want to have a good night sleep. Next time I will pick Un Ciel a Paris (B&B) or Les Toits de Paris (B&B) Those two are not so touristic and it is possible to have breakfast at their place without paying extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In The Middle Of It All”
Reviews.Author: mkings12
Reviews.Content: After staying for 5 nights just this past week at the Saint Severin, I cannot say enough about this hotel. The location cannot be beat for being so close to everything you need, the staff is attentive and very patient, our room (#517) was spotless and very comfortable. Go for the deluxe room with a balcony. Even though it is tiny, it is just big enough to sit at the table and enjoy a bottle of wine and watch all of the activity below. My wife and I cannot speak to the breakfast they serve because the allure of finding that amazing brasserie was too much to resist each morning. They even went above and beyond helping our lost friends find us at Au Bougnat, and even calling ahead to the restaurant to let them know our friends were coming so we could move to a table of four. The only negative, if you can call it that is the lack of available plugs in the room, other than that, if you are looking for a clean, roomy space to call home right in the center of it all in Paris, you cannot beat this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ah, balcony...”
Reviews.Author: waiahbi
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I chose the balcony room for a one night stay. I've always dreamed of waking up in Paris and sitting on a balcony, just watching the sky change colors. The room was small, but charming, and the bathroom was extremely new and clean. The reception is opened 24 hours, and the staff are all very friendly and speak fluent English in case you have questions. We did not take part in their breakfast as there were a few boulangeries by the hotel that opened early. Notes: only one outlet in the room, one in the bathroom; small space; wifi daily for 3 euro; safe in the room; mini bar; luggage room There's nothing like waking up and watching Paris wakes up on a balcony, next to buildings with balconies... for that morning, I was a Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: donnelbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Front desk staff were helpful and spoke english. Rooms were simple but comfortable. Wifi was available for a fee. Location was excellent; very close to St Michel/Notre Dame station and in the heart of the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jenny49_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and the room was very pleasant overlooking an interior courtyard, newly refurbished and clean. Could not hear any noise from the Latin quarter right outside the front door. Absolutely excellent location and very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A well priced gem in the heart of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: whatsuptigerlily
Reviews.Content: - 99euros for a double room ensuite, with a juliette balcony overlooking the street - small but completely acceptable room, double shower, lovely refurbishment of the rooms -dont be put off by the corridors, the rooms look much better! -the buzz of the latin quarter did not disturb me but it is a consideration for others who are easily woken -two minutes from st michel RER and metro, for ease of access to the rest of the city and the airport (trains to CDG regularly during the day). -the latin quarter is a fun place to drink, and you can eat cheaply if you are not fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very clean, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Monta22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 09 and were extremely happy with the hotel and the price. Best thing about the hotel is the unbeatable location, with so many iconic sites within walking distance: Notre Dame, Louvre, Shakespeare & Co bookshop, Luxembourg Gardens, etc etc, plus loads of cafes, restaurants, bars, shops and boutiques..... The room is very small but bed was comfortable and the bathroom is clean and adequate. Plus we had a little balcony with amazing view over the bustling St Germain streets. But no noise bothered us at night at all. To be honest, you won't want to spend any time in ur room with so much to see and Parisian life to discover!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel- great location!”
Reviews.Author: janerenae
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We were in Paris for 5 days, and stayed here the whole time. You are right next to Notre Dame, and within walking distance of most of the major sites. You are also right next to the RER stop which makes it very convenience to get to the airport & also Versailles (if that is in your travel plans). Every person who worked there was very friendly & spoke English. The resident cat was very sweet as well. We had room 204- no balcony. I did not think the room size was an issue. Compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Europe, it was plenty of space. The bathroom was extremely tiny though, but it was functional & clean. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: mdev
Reviews.Content: The room really is tiny but judging by photos on this site it looks like some are a lot bigger than others. We had room 205 with a balcony which definitley added a nice Parisian/romantic feel to the room but I wonder if rooms without balconies are bigger? I would be interested to find out. I never stayed in central Paris before so I cannot compare it to anything else unfortunately. Check in was perfect and the girl was very friendly. The bed wasnt terribly comfortable but it was fine! The room was a bit chilly at times- I dont know if the balcony contributed to this but the air con/ heater most certainly did not heat the room up. Handy to have a TV, hairdryer little mini bar and plenty of storage space in my opinion. Some poeple have mentioned lack of safet deposit boxes and plug sockets but our roomm had plenty of sockets and a working safety deposit box. The room was cleaned every day and we received fresh towels also. Some people have conplained about the noise but I wouldnt even mention it to be honest. Everything closes really early (12/1 am) which surprised me after reading some of the reviews here. If you are staying in the heart of the Latin Quarter what do you expect ? Similarly I thought that the size of the bathroom was fine... Location is ideal- I booked meals in two of the top ten restaurants on TA and both were a short walk away (max 10/12 minute walk). Right beside Notre Dame and Shakespeare and Co and a direct line to the Eiffel Tower (RER C roughly 10 minute journey). You can catch a bus to the Louvre that takes you directly there roughly a 4 minute journey.... I have mixed feelings however while as I would recommend this to a friend I would ensure that they are aware of the room size, temperature in March etc. I really dont think I would bring my parents here as they would probably rather somehting a bit further out that has a bit more comfort. However I suspect that had I stayed in any other location I would not have enjoyed my trip to Paris as much nor would I have had time to see so much. There are plenty of little wine bars around if you take a stroll that are open till roughly 1.30/2 am and if you are into nightlife thats just around the corner too. I payed €120 for the room... I feel €100 would have been a fairer price OR if breakfast was included it would have felt like better value. I know that rooms are available for €80 - these were all booked up when we tried to book one but I think had I payed €80 per night I would definitley feel as if I had better value for money I dont think the extra €40 for a balcony is worth it. Some people have also said that the staff seemed rude...initally I also thought this but after my 3 day stay I can say that they were extremely helpful with everything and the guy on at the night time was actually very nice and accomodating to any request we had and tried to make conversation with us always.
