Overall location is excellent, if you can get a room without a balcony value for money is excellent, it is clean and friendly however if you are perhaps a little bit older and are looking for a luxurios break in Paris stay further out....if you want to stay in the action but still have a lovely romantic break this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: basulto
Reviews.Content: A really, really cool boutique hotel. In the Latin Quarter, about 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame, with plenty of excellent and well priced places to eat within easy distance. The walk will take more than 20 minutes if you stop at as many bars and cafes as we did though...But more importantly, the room was very romantic, with a modern design..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lydsmate
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with a friend and stayed here for the duration of our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but when you're in Paris, how much time do you intend to spend in your room? The restaurants near by were very cheap (between 10& 16 Euros for a 3 course meal) and were very tasty. Also it was perfect for the metro, as it was a short walk away from the metro/RER. I would defineatly stay here again and recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Petfect location”
Reviews.Author: KLHM
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable, friendly and spotlessly clean hotel. The location couldn't be better for sight seeing and eating french food. Thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wilko-pink
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay and had a fantastic time. - between 3 metro stations only a short walk - we got the metro direct from CDG airport - staff friendly and helpful - reasonable priced internet, could pay for a time block 24hrs up - right in middle of reasonable priced restaurants (from 10Euros for 3 course meal) - drinks nearby expensive but supermarket about 5 mins walk tha sold everything - room quite small but does not cause any problems - we were two friends sharing a double to save on price and the bed was plenty big enough - we found cheapest to book direct with hotel - rooms cleaned well daily - room looked nice had mini bar, tv, coat hangers, shelves and hanging space, air con heating, shower, lift - TV with international news channels - window over looking busy street but no problem with noise and we went to bed quite early - you can buy Disney tickets at the hotel (pay part to hotel and part when arrive) - area very safe and friendly - we did not get the breakfast but pastries from near by shop all in all had a great stay and would really recommend this area and hotel for a base for exploring paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy room.”
Reviews.Author: willbb1977
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is just off Rue St Michel near the Seine, so very convenient for rail links around the city and to the airport and eurostar direct on the Rer. Aside from this it is in the heart of latin quarter bustle so there are lots of bistro and shops surrounding. The italian below the hotel is excellent and worth forgoing eating just french food while in Paris. The room was the smallest on the floor (504) but it was spotless, well equipped, and had a balcony above the street adding to the atmosphere, without being at all noisy. Final note is the Velib station outside. Brilliant and convenient, paris rental bikes are just outside when you need to get somewhere without the hassle of the metro while burning off some of the previous days indulgence! Great little hotel, will return.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: clementine14
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Our room was small as expected, but what was not expected was the cold showers. We asked to move rooms, and were told none were available, although we are aware that the room next door was unoccupied as were we directed to shower there, (after we twice asked reception staff to address the issue of no hot water). Given the relatively high tariff, it did not seem unreasonable to expect a hot shower especially in the middle of winter. The rooms are not soundproof, nor are bathroom fixtures such as toilet seats attached to the toilet base, making urinating rather perilous. We checked out after one night, there was no apology nor reduction in tariff. We found an excellent hotel around the corner and would recommend Hotel Royal Saint-Michel to others looking for a hotel in this area.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stanf96
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a great location. close to metro about 200 meters. close to notre dame. overall no problems. the rooms are small, it isn't the Ritz but overall is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - but very small room”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_Scofield
Reviews.Content: Very ok hotel with a very good location. We pre booked direct from the hotel, and they was fast to answer and very polite. We requested a room high up and we ended up on the 6th floor, that was ok. But the room was a little bit disappointing, the pictures at internet is better than it seems. We had a very small rom, small bathroom, but it was clean and tidy. The people at the front desk was always very helpful. Nice restaurant that is also the breakfast room, but the people working there could smile a little bit...i did not feel so much welcome there. But after all, a nice hotel, good location, but it is a little bit expensive compared to others in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk and nice, cheap rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ms_D_Writes
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to our favourite restaurants and bookshops and the Cluny, and selected this one entirely on those criteria. It was a happy chance! The front desk was populated with wonderful staff who were only too happy to help at any hour (including a 5am emergency confab when we were stranded thanks to broken-down Eurostars). In addition to the human staff, we were privileged to meet Isis, who made our stay even more special. Sited within easy distance of St Michel metro, and a very short walk from Notre Dame , it is a beautifully located hotel, there's even a velib stand right out the front. Rooms are very comfortable and large for the price and area. The bathroom in the triple room was pleasantly large, and included a full-sized bath. I also stayed an extra night in a single, which had the standard small Paris bathroom, but was nicely appointed nonetheless. We were there when the temperature plumetted and early blizzards rolled in. The heating was up to scratch in every part of the hotel, without being oppressively so. Next door is an Italian restaurant, which made me laugh at first, but we had the second-best meals of our trip there at a third the cost of the best. Aside from this and some of the good little street food stalls nearby, you're safer heading down to Saint-Germain for food, as most of the nearest eateries are more concerned with tourist trade. While it is really just a nice mid-price hotel, the excellent staff really lifted the experience of staying here and made it a firm fave for all three of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rockyjoe
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a fantastic location. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the city's most popular tourist sights, including Notre-Dame, Saint-Germain-des-Prés, the River Seine, the Louvre and the Orsay Museum. It is also really close to the St. Michel Metro Station and near tons of restaurants. The room was very small but nice. Our room was on the street side and we did not hear any street noise. There is a computer in the lobby with internet access but it did not work well at all. It took me about 20 minutes to write one short e-mail (I gave up after that). The staff at the front desk were friendly and all spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT ... LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: IceRonin
Reviews.Content: The cat is cute ... but the hotel location is better. Lots of restaurants and a 3 minute walk from Notre Damme ... Excellent Hotel. Clean and friendly staff. GO FOR IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than you expect”
Reviews.Author: strevo
Reviews.Content: We saw this rated as 2-star on trip advisor but it is much more than that. We had a great room and the location is superb. We had no problems with noise as the windows are double glazed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. In fact we had no problems at all. Lucky? Perhaps, but then again, this doesn't happen by accident. All things considered, this is a great place to stay. It doesn't pretend to be something it is not Steve and Pam

Reviews.Title: “Good location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: winedine1
Reviews.Content: The hotel have a very central location in the Latiner Quartier. The room is very small and the air condition dosen't work properly, and it was very much noise from the street all day and night. A simple hotel with good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: rsprouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October on our first trip to Paris. It was a little jewel box of a hotel. An outstanding location in the heart of everything. Plenty of great restaurant options within walking distance. The staff was very nice and our room was clean and modern. The only negatives that I can come up with is that the balcony rooms may be a problem for those that are light sleepers. NIghtlife is right outside your window and it stayed lively until the wee hours of the morning. The noise did not bother my wife or myself one bit, but we live in the city and like noise. We would gladly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, cute hotel cat”
Reviews.Author: shan055
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The location is the best thing about this hotel - exceptional, one block from the St. Michel metro and a few blocks from the RER (airport train line), as well as a few blocks from Notre Dame. The rooms are average size, very clean, and average decor. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and they have a great cat who sleeps in the lobby (Isis, she is a sweetie). There is one computer in the lobby that guests can use (you buy a Wi-Fi card from the hotel for 5 Eur per 24 hours, or pay for Wi-Fi in your room if you have your own computer). There are lots of restaurants around the neighborhood and the Latin Quarter is a safe and lively area. We stayed at this hotel years ago and returned this time to find the same nice place. One negative is that the street in front of the hotel is very noisy with restaurants and nightlife, so sleeping was a little bit difficult - ear plugs helped. The carpet in the hallways could use a little sprucing up, but all in all, a comfortable, clean hotel. Breakfast was 12 Eur so we got coffees and baked treats down the street at Starbucks and other surrounding cafes. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: ozygurl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in September, and couldn't have been more pleased. Only metres from the St Michel Metro station off the Boulevard St Michel, we were ideally located to explore the sights on foot. In addition, there were a multitude of restaurants and cafes right on our doorstep. The room was basic, but very functional, although the shower was miniscule. Hotel staff were friendly and service was of a high standard. Highly recommend to those who would like to really get a feel for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here twice and would come back again”
Reviews.Author: missoriginality
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this great little hotel in July 2010 and, on returning to Paris in September, chose to stay here again. The rooms are a great size (particularly for Europe!) and are clean and practical. The service is good - we were even given an upgrade to a deluxe room with a balcony for no reason! Although the best thing about this hotel is the location. Right in the heart of the Latin Quarter and an easy stroll to the Metro, RER, Notre Dame and many exciting restaurants and bars. I definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel to stay at in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JWT0706
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this lovely hotel - just across from the Notre Dame cathedral. Great value for money! We were 3 and this room had a fantastic, spacious room for 3 at £180! Classy, comfortable and trendy - we loved our room. Bathroom was good. Our friends stayed in the luxury suite upstairs and had breakfast thrown in which they said was very good. We skipped breakfast because we opted for fresh patisserie from the boulangerie around the corner. This hotel is a 20 minute walk to Les Halles and Le Marais. We also walked 20 mins in the other direction to get to la rue Mouffetarde. The staff were ok and friendly enough. I have stayed in various hotels in Paris and this one beats them all! I loved it and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-located hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Cynthia
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Europe St. Severin for a weekend get away to Paris based on walking by it and being impressed by the lobby/staff on a past visit. This was our 10th trip to Paris over the past decade. In the past, we have stayed predomenently in the 7thArr. though we have also stayed in the 1st & 6th. The hotel was perfectly located two blocks off the Seine and just off of Rue St. Michel. Parking in the St. Michel parking lot was easy less than 100m away for a fee of 25 Euro per day. The hotel was clean, convenient, and the staff was freindly. The price was clearly indicative of the location and maybe a bit pricey for the 2 star rating but in our view was worth the money for the convenience. The Metro was a two minute walk from the hotel, as was the RER. The walk to Boulevard St. Germain was just 4 minutes, as was the walk to Notre Dame. We tried several resturaunts in the area that we recommend. Two that stand out are Le 24, which is off of Boul. St. Germain on an alley less than 500m from the hotel and served excellent traditional French food and Chez Ernest is a mere 90m from the hotel and served a fantastic menu at VERY reasonable prices. Some areas for improvement on the part of the hotel: (1) On two occasions we were given the wrong room key by the hotel reception. It only caused a minor inconvenience but the fact is that for the short period we had a different key in our posession, we "could have" had access to other folks rooms were we dishonest people. (2) The housekeeping staff apparently employs a color blind maid who cannot tell the difference between the bright red "Do Not Disturb" sign and the bright green "Please Make Up Room" sign. We had to stop her from entering one morning at 0900 while we were showering and preparing for the day. These minor issues aside, we do recommend the hotel and will stay there again when we visit the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dalia_Ghaly
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days in paris me , my husbnad, my 6 years old daughter and our 17th month baby , the hotel was in a very lively and vibrant neighborhood, the triple room was aith adequate size, the hotel staff was very helpful they let us check in early at 7:00 AM with no extra charges , though they neglect our request during booking about providing a cot but to be frank snce we spent all out time exploring the city we did not ask for it , the hotel is surrounded by dozens of resturants and night spots and they are opened till after 2:00 AM , it is 2 blocks away from st Michel metro station, 2 minutes walk to 2 stops of open tour, and 1 minute wlak from seine river , it is defeinietly better that Madeline area in which I stayed before, , overall the hotel is good with very resonbale price next time will stay in same neighborhood but I may try another hotel , I recommend it for young couples and families for the location and value for money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler14
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location could not be more perfect for the Latin Quarter and sightseeing locations in that area. Everything is literally around the corner. The deluxe room price via their website was about average for hotels in the area so it was not a steal but acceptable for Paris prices. I requested a quiet room, so it was on the inner courtyard side and not the street side, which was blissfully quiet and peaceful. We couldn't hear anyone inside the hotel and certainly not any street noise despite being in a very busy part of town/street. A/C was great but hardly needed and the room was a nice size with a small sitting area, bed area and decent-sized bathroom. It was perfectly clean and nicely decorated. My travel partner who has quite high standards was raving about the comfort and location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the left bank!”
Reviews.Author: KylieW45
Reviews.Content: I had discovered this hotel on the Trip Advisor website and what a find it is. The rooms are clean and well maintained and the location is fantastic. In the heart of the left bank and surrounded by great shops and restaurants, I'd highly recommend this hotel. The cost is very agreeable too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: fistuk
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter have stayed in the hotel for six nights on the first week of July. It is my wife's fifth visit to Paris and the best one so far, primarily because of the hotel. It is centerally located in a safe yet busy quartier latin with all the facilities within close reach. Some tips which I used after reading the reviews. I called the front desk after making the reservation and asked for a quiet room because of the potential street noise. A quiet room which faces the hotel inward was reserved and my wife and daughter did not hear a sound! So all the noise sensitive sleepers can be reassured. The only but was that the room was a little bit smaller than the other rooms, but this was only a minor issue. There is no coffee maker in the room, so they brought an elecrtic kettle which was very helpful. Other than that, all reviewers praises are reconfirmed and we do highly recommend this Parisienne atmosphere hotel much more then any other chain hotels even with the same rating

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: flamingo66
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews as I have good luck using the site in the past. Excellent location. Steps from the Metro and RER and a fairly easy walk to to Notre Dame, Louve, and Cluny Museum. Some decent restaurants in the surrounding area and some killer gyro shops. Hotel staff was very friendly although the English to French was not always great. But they got us where we were going. Room was on 5th floor with a small balcony we used for breakfast after buying some stuff at a local market. While the air conditioner is not up to Houston, Texas standards, it did fine and it was cool enough we could open our balcony doors at night to help it cool and the street noise was not an issue. Bath and furnishings were great with the wood floors and stone wall behind the bed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. And the room staff always kept our room spotless. Also, while there, if you you time look into the bike tours of Paris offered by Fat Tire Bike Tours. We took the night ride and it included a boat ride down the Seine. Lots of fun and it is run by American kids so you get to practice your English again!!! Money well spent on the hotel and the bike ride.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay--will return”
Reviews.Author: Genyi1681
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our recent (and first) trip to Paris. It was a bit overwhelming trying to decide on a hotel, but I feel like we hit the jackpot with this one. We'll definitely stay here next time we are lucky enough to be in Paris. First off, its a fantastic location in the Latin Quarter, very central to the metro and close to Notre Dame. There are about a million cool shops and yummy restaurants within walking distance and many are very reasonable. Our room had a charming little balcony, and an exposed stone wall, which I though was very cool. Yes the room and bathroom were on the small side, but I understand this is common in Europe, and frankly I think it adds to the experience. Though we stayed for 5 nights, and Saint-Severin can be a busy street with nightlife, tourists, and performers esp. on the weekend, we didn't have any noise issues. The staff was very helpful, and spoke english very well, which was good since our french is terrible (though we did try, which they seemed to appreciate!) Finally, we really enjoyed the hotel cat, Isis, who was always sleeping on the sofa downstairs. It may seem silly, but she made the place feel quite homey and welcoming, and made us a bit less homesick for our own cats!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and an Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: RWills81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay and relax from the fast pace and large city of Paris. We had a room on the 5th floor with a balcony. Balconies and Paris are worth the extra price. The view down to the street gave us endless entertainment eating on our balcony from the food we picked up at the open markets or viewing the morning sun reflecting of the Paris rooftops. Not only was the balcony alone great but the room was much bigger than your average Paris Hotel with a comfortable bed and A/C. People complain about the noise outside as the Latin Quarters is a hot spot, I didn't think it was bad at all, close the windows you don't hear anything, open them up and its the sounds of Paris, can't go wrong either way. The staff was very nice and helpful, we didn't have a chance to eat dinner or breakfast at the restaurant and I would go back to this place again. You are around the corner from Saint Michael Fountain and less than 5 minute walk to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: snarfley
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's expensive for the size of the rooms, but the location is excellent. Paid a little extra for a balcony, which is worth it. Rooms have everything you need. Right near the RER if you have a flight from CDG to catch (which I did). Near great shopping, food, sights. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: nightress
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed everything about my stay with the hotel. The room was stunning and very quite, we did check out trip advisor and most guest said that it was loud till 3 in the area, and tbh i didnt have any problems i found it to be quite i heared no noise at all. The hotel is in a great loaction, its just around the cornor from notra dame and about 20min walk to the louvre. If you dont want to walk far the metro is aroud the cornor, or the boata bus which stops at every major attraction. The staff where very friendly and willing to help out as much as they could reguarding directions. I loved the little cat isis. The hotel had a very friendly atmosphere. I loved the whole atmosphere of the area when we stayed, There was a whole music festival on the monday, tuesday there was street dancers and perfoming art dancers. I'm not sure if we where lucky or it here all the time, but for me it made the trip a lil more special and exciting. I'm defo planning a return trip with my partner. I loved isis the cat she was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK but I would look elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: randyg1124
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but was mostly clean, stayed on the 4th floor which had a balcony. A/C did not work either did the TV. Location is good. The breakfast is not worth the 12 euros (very much a rip-off). Staff was OK. I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “A most wonderful stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: vmcj
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel and can't imagine staying elsewhere. The hotel rooms are much more than the star ratings would indicate. They are clean and quiet despite being in the midst of the Latin Quarter hub of St. Michel. Only minutes to the Seine, Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, cafes, restaurants, shopping etc. The staff are the friendliest of all hotel staff we have come upon during many visits to Paris. The staff are helpful, knowledgeable and go above and beyond to make your stay a pleasure. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: clausmte
Reviews.Content: -First of all the location of this hotel is excellent, just two blocks from the Metro St. Michele /St. Germain, and easy to get to from the Airport CDG Roissy. -The staff is very helpful, they speak very well English, and reccomended us a nice restaurant to celebrate my birthday. -There are several cafes and restaurants to choose, however it is worth it to walk a couple of blocks south of boulevard St. Michel to avoid the "tourist" restaurants, and find nicer and cozier places. Overall the whole area is full of life, you see a lot of people -locals and tourists, walking in the streets, having a drink or eating the outdoors cafes. -Our room was clean and spacious. We had a suite, and for our surprise it was like a little duplex, very peculiar and nice. -We went last May so the weather was very nice in Paris. We were lucky in that sense because we did not see any A/C unit, and had to open the windows, but we slept very well, although for some people may be difficult due to some noise during the night, but it is not very bad. We could see from out window the NotreDame cathedral. -There is a cute cat who lives in the hotel, her name is Isis, and according to one of the staff members -"She is the boss" - We are a young to not so young couple (our age average is 46 years old of age), so we think for us and for younger people, this is a good place and location, maybe for bigger families and people who would like a more relaxed time, this location may not be suitable. -Overall a great experience. We are planning to go back to Paris and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money. My 3rd time at this hotel...that says it all”
Reviews.Author: LRO2008
Reviews.Content: Once again, i was not disappointed with the St Severin. Had a comfortable room on the 4th floor,over looking the Rue St Severin...my favorite location in the hotel. The front desk staff all speak English and are very helpful, in our case particularly so for my friend when her flight back to the US was cancelled -becos of the volcano ash problem -and she had to stay on for 4 extra days. The hotel is located steps away from the St Michel Metro station, and Notre Dame is a 5 minute walk. There are literally dozens of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdawg2201
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in the Latin Quarter. The hotel staff was very helpful. The room was small but that is common in Europe. But very clean and look nice. the bet was comfortable. The room had a nice little mini-bar. The location was in a good location for me, it was around the block from RER and the Metro, and just across the bridge fromNotre Dame de Paris. The only down side was the room was noisy from people on the street. but that did not bother me. Now the strange thing about this hotel was you left your key at the desk when you left. but over all for the price a very nice hotel and would stay there again next time i go.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, nice area and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nath182
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and is around 2 minute walk from the Notre Dame and 15-20 mins to Le Louvre. There are around 30 restaurants within a 1 minute walk from the hotel so you can always find somewhere to eat night and day. The only thing I could note would be the lack of power sockets in the room, we were in room 214 and the only power socket in the room was behind a large wooden set of drawers containing the safe and the fridge which were plugged into the socket. Other than that the room was perfect, a comfortable bed, a nicely decorated ensuite bathroom with shower. There was a lot of noise from outside but the double glazing windows kept the majority of that out. Overall I would definately recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Paris and wanting a central location.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed for two nights on the last weekend of Feb and had a wonderful time from this hotel. Between us we had rooms 215, 216 and 514 - all were fine although 514 was slightly larger and more modern, with more sun as it was on a higher floor. From start to finish there was very little to complain about with the hotel. Previous reviews have mentions the luggage room is not locked so hardly secure, don't leave anything valuable in the bags stored there, which is common sense, and we did open our window on the second floor to cool the room which was quite hot when we came back - but the noise from the street was minimal and certainly not a problem. There's some bustle but it closes at a reasonable time. Arriving at the hotel from the airport was a snip on the train, just 4 stops and a 200 yard walk. Going back took longer due to weekend working on the lines, whic his worth checking as the delay could be significant and cause a missed plane. Our flgiht was cancelled and the hotel staff were helpful in finding rooms for us and also in contacting Air France. This is the Latin Quater, it's a busy area, so there's a lot around you in terms of places to eat, drink and walk. Do not come here for a quiet reclusive weekend, it simply will not happen. Worth noting there's a Canadian bar nearby where beer was actually affordable. Paris is expensive these days. The Eglise is lovely and a very plesant surprise. Public Internet access is a single Pc in the foyer, a bit slow and a French keyboard to get used to. Overall we can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to Sleep Here!”
Reviews.Author: EricaLynn
Reviews.Content: I really really wanted to adore this hotel, where my husband and I stayed for three nights in November 2009. When we got off the RER B from CDG at the Notre Dame/St. Michel station without having to change trains and then had to carry our luggage less than a half-block to the Hotel Europe Saint Severin, I bragged to my husband about how I’d clearly done a great job picking a well-located hotel. We entered the charmingly worn lobby and were greeted by the resident cat, and I was in love. We arrived around 8 in the morning and learned that the hotel was completely full, so our room wouldn’t be ready until the official 1 pm check-in time. We therefore stored our luggage (note that storage is in an unlocked closet hidden around a corner from the reception desk, so I wouldn’t describe it as secure) and ventured out to wander around the city. Our room was ready when we returned at 1:00. We booked a superior double room with balcony and had requested a renovated room at the time of booking, after having read here that some rooms have yet to be renovated. Reception had noted this request and confirmed that they were assigning us to a renovated room, located on the second floor. We avoided the hotel breakfast and Italian restaurant, since this is Paris and there are much better dining options everywhere you turn. Of note, staff spoke excellent English and were generally helpful. The hotel had an odd practice of requiring guests to leave their room keys at the front desk when they left the property, but we rarely had to wait long to get our key back when we returned to the hotel. I did notice that even if we came in and spoke with a receptionist we’d not previously seen, all we had to do was state our room number, and we were handed the key without any confirmation we actually belonged in that room – obviously, traveling with valuables is a bad idea in general, but this particular hotel definitely had some lax security practices. We used a tiny creaky elevator to bring our luggage upstairs but otherwise used the stairs throughout the rest of our stay. The clean, tastefully-decorated room was somewhat small but pretty typical for Europe, and the layout and use of a pocket door for the bathroom optimized the use of space. There was a decent amount of drawer and hanging space, and the small safe in the armoire could accommodate several cameras, a netbook, and important documents. Double doors opened to the balcony, which was essentially a narrow platform running along the outside of the building, with iron gating used to provide symbolic (though not really physical or visual) separation of the balcony areas for neighboring rooms. There was a tiny outdoor café table and two chairs situated on the balcony, and the view was of the bustle of the pedestrian Rue Saint-Severin. This bustle is a great segway into why I would never again stay at this hotel, as incredibly charming, well-located, and reasonably priced (for Paris, anyway) as it was. When I travel, I spend very limited time in my hotel room and generally use it for the sole purpose of sleeping. Unfortunately, sleeping is virtually impossible at the Hotel Europe Saint Severin. The noise from the street is incredibly loud at all hours of the day, be it a weeknight or weekend night. We thought we might get some relief when the restaurants closed in the wee hours of the morning, but apparently this is when construction vehicles move in to take advantage of the lack of pedestrians – they started doing work on one of the buildings across the street using very heavy equipment and lots of loud machines. My understanding from reading reviews was that double-glazed windows in the renovated rooms meant guests could hear very little from the street, but that couldn’t be further from the truth! I travel a fair amount and was prepared with earplugs, yet even with these in (coupled with a dose of sleep medication one night out of desperation!), the noise remained unbearable. It’s worth noting that I’m a light sleeper, but even my husband (who could probably sleep through a home burglary) was disturbed by the noise. Further complicating things is the fact that the hotel’s HVAC system is set up such that it can provide either heating or cooling, but not both. Because we were there in November, they’d switched over to heat for the season, and the switching process is apparently complicated enough that it can’t be modified to account for weather fluctuations. The weather during our stay was unseasonably warm (in the 60s F), and there was clearly a lot of additional heat being generated from the building, as it was VERY hot in our room. For perspective, I should mention that I get cold very easily and frequently set the heat in my home to 75+ degrees and still shiver a bit…so for me to feel the hotel room was uncomfortably warm is saying a lot. Not realizing the HVAC circumstances, we turned our room thermostat to cool with the fan on high. This only made it hotter, as it blew hot air instead of cold (this is when we spoke with reception and found out that there was no functional A/C). So what choice did we have? Right, we opened the balcony doors. There were two huge problems with this, however. As I mentioned, the balcony wasn’t really separated from the balconies of other rooms, so anyone could have simply walked into our room while we were sleeping. The bigger problem, as I’m sure you’ve guessed if you’ve been reading this entire review, is that the open doors meant the already-atrocious noise situation became completely intolerable. Even in writing this review, I’m nostalgically recalling the romance of the hotel and its location. But I can’t stress enough that no matter how tempting it might seem, you should avoid staying here if you want to get any sleep at all – it’s not worth ruining your vacation because you’re simply too exhausted to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT hotel”
Reviews.Author: pu9
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my friend for 5 nights. When we first arrived the receptionist was very friendly, and helped us with everything! And it stayed that way through our entire stay. This was really the best hotel I've stayed at in Paris so far. Great location, a good bar street, and if you take the metro a couple of stops you come to a great shopping quarter(saint german). We slept like baby's each night in our fantastic room. Its a mystery this hotel is just rated as a ** hotel, because it really felt like so much more! I'll definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and Great valuey for money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_818
Reviews.Content: We booked online for this hotel from their main website for 6 days stay (Feb 10-16, 2010) and didn't found any problem. Right away on the same day of my booking I received a confirmation for my booking from the Hotel. Great value for the price since its a two star hotel but the location is amazing. We didn't have problem going to any place since the hotel is very near to RER St Michel station. We didn't even book for any travel tour (considering we have kids along with us), we are just travelling by ourselves thru train. Very accessible and restaurants are just outside the hotel door. Mc donalds is near and you can even see a small supermarket just a block away from the hotel. Hotel staff (Canan, Ana and the rest of staff) are very helpful and accomodating. They even arranged our shuttle to pick us from the airport at a very friendly price. So no worries at all. Wifi is also available for a small fine. We tried the breakfast from the hotel and found it fair for the price but we suggest to try also from other restaurant outside that have same cheap price. We will definitely stay on this hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenBella
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and I'd fully recommend it! Friendly staff in a truely charming, original parisian hotel, in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant base for easy access”
Reviews.Author: wdb30
Reviews.Content: We did weekend with another couple and walked, wined and dined a lot! Ask for a balcony, only £10 a night more. V small room but OK for a base. Tiny but really nice bathroom. Bad sleeps though, A/C made a noise but didn't cool the room, have to keep 2nd floor windows shut for noise so very hot and sticky night. Probably my fault for forgetting to raise it with the hotel!ichel Metro and hence everywhere else. Plenty within short walking distance too, check out the narrow alleys just to the west for some great restaurants, but watch the bar that charges £10 for a pint. Say hello to the famous cat that sleeps 24/7 in reception. Would stay here every time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location (In the Heart of it All)”
Reviews.Author: kprunella
Reviews.Content: - Good Size Room (Queen Bed) - Very Clean - Walking Distance to Notre Dame. - In the Middle of Resturant and Market Area Review: Stayed 1 Night at this Hotel. This was twoard the end of our One Month Trip. Started out in paris for 7 Nights at a different Hotel then made our way around the country back to Paris for one more night. It's a easy walk to this hotel from the Metro (St-Michel). It's in a pedestrian area with many Resturants and Markets. The hotel staff wasn't very friendly, but they where helpful. The room was spacious, clean and had a nice view of the market area. Safe Location. Fairly quiet being in such a busy, populated area. Good size bathroom very clean. Small Service Elevator. Quick walk to Notre Dame. Near the Metro Line that can take you to the Louvre and Orsay. We walked it was about 15 mins. Directions: From Paris Gare Lyon. Take Line 1 (La Defense) to Chatlet. From Chatlet take Line 4 (Porte d'Orleans) to St-Michel. From there it's a quick 8 Min walk south-east from the Station.

Reviews.Title: “Could not beat the rate, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MSK-SJ
Reviews.Content: I have never left a review before so this is a first, this might be long but these reviews have been so helpful. We booked directly though the hotel's website which gave us the cheapest rate. The location is off the corner from Place Saint Michel, there is a Metro Station right there. We found this to be one of the best stops because if you used the Metro as much as we did, the Saint-Michael / Notre Dame stop is well connected to other Metro lines. The Hotel is also about two blocks from the Notre Dame cathedral. It's location was great for all the tourist attractions. This is not a 5 star hotel, it is two star, but since we wanted a safe, clean place just to sleep and at an affordable price this fit the bill. The staff was friendly and spoke very good English, in fact we arrived early and they got our room made up in an hour. They have an area to leave baggage, don't freak out, there is no lock on the door and they don't give you a ticket but apparently it's safe -- our bags where there upon our return. Since from all the reviews I have read that Paris hotel rooms are small I was mentally prepared and our room was small. The room was very clean, comfortable bed, don't bring big suitcases, they have an armoire to hang your clothes, small flat panel TV (that had CNN intl). The shower is small but had excellent pressure and very hot water but word of advice bring your own toiletries, the Hotel only provides a bar of soap. The downside is since we were there during the start of winter we would open the windows to let in the cool air (since they turn off the AC) and since our room faced the street you would hear the noise from the street which included loud bars, cafes, drunken Parisians singing at the top of their lungs and at 5:00 am the beep, beep, beep of the garbage truck and weekends were worse. See if you can book a room towards the inside. I would not book with breakfast included since there so many restaurants all around and right around the corner to the left was a bakery that was open very early that has baguettes and croissants and good coffee. The area of the hotel is in the Latin Quarter, so it looks like something out of a postcard from France with cafes and cobblestone streets and lots and lots of restaurants and tourist shops. You're near the area of the Sorbonne, so there are a lot of students. By the way, you also have to leave the key every time you leave the room with the front desk which took us a while to get used to, but nothing happened. There is no free wi fi, you pay about 3 euros and they give you a code which is good for 24 hours, but as we found out free Wi FI is quite rare in Paris, if your lucky, some Mcdonald's have it but it was very iffy. I wouldn't recommend this Hotel for a family but for a couple or a single traveler, this is a good hotel with an affordable, central location to get to all your must see stops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: manyplaceslittletime
Reviews.Content: Superb location, clean and tidy hotel. Staff are friendly , knowledgeable and helpful. Good breakfast (cost 12 Euros). Cheapest rooms are very small but comfortable. Lovely resident cat (ISIS). Wi-Fi (charge). Lots of restaurants in the area. An excellent base to explore Paris, we will stay there again. Book directly on the hotel website - these are the cheapest rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great second stay!”
Reviews.Author: texgem
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay here, and I wasn't disappointed! The five star is for the value and cleanliness. Great location in the bustling st Michel area. Literally steps away from st Michel metro station and an easy walk to Notre dame. It's located on a side street, and a balcony room is a must. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and speak English. The room was adequate, bed comfortable, and bathroom was clean with great water pressure in the shower. Will definitely stay here again! The restaurant across the street, Le Menhir, is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable value for money hotel .”
Reviews.Author: Italytrippers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Europe St Severin for 3 days last week. This was our 3rd visit to the St Michel area, all in different hotels. Still looking for the right hotel! The Europe St Severin hotel was value for money for the rate I paid. I suggest the proprietors of the Europe St Severin invest a bit of time and effort into a spruce up of the hotel. My initial impression was of a hotel being loved to death. It is obviously very popular and the location and pricing are great but just a bit more attention is required. Our room was clean as was hotel itself. All staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke English happily. Our polite efforts in French are excruciatingly awful. We had a balcony room overlooking Rue de La Harpe, which with restaurants the length of it is very noisy and smelly unless one loves Indian, Asian et al. The combined aromas wafted up and into the room. Double glazing on doors and windows would be advantageous. Rubbish dumpster and street washing trucks very early in the mornings made an horrendous noise and late night restaurant clients were also audible. The hotel guests were not noisy in themselves but noise from rooms and corridors did travel. The bedroom was spacious, had the most floor area we have had in a Parisian hotel. As is common in France the toilet was a tiny room separate from the bathroom area, which was a very small open plan door-less space with large corner bath behind the built -in wardrobe wall. No privacy with visibility from bedroom area. The shower is going to cause water ingress behind the tiled walls. Other critiques have mentioned the idiosyncrasies of the handheld showers and in a building the age of this one I'd have concerns about structural damage it must be causing. 2 of the bedroom lights had the wobbles and required maintenance attention. Room had appropriate furniture and bed was one large bed, in Europe called a Matrimoniale - not two large singles pushed together, so that was good. Overall decor spartan but adequate. The wooden floors are very cold in winter, in fact the room was very cold but admittedly winter arrived unexpectedly early in Paris. Bed with duvet was warm and comfy. I particularly sought out a room with balcony which we valiantly used in spite of freezing conditions out on it (not hotel's fault obviously) but suggest they ditch the absurd recycled black rubber tyre chairs. They might be waterproof but are ugly, uncomfortably low, only suitable for people the height of a pygmy. Two weatherproof outdoor chairs of a normal height would enable guests to enjoy their balcony and watch whatever is going on up and down the streets. The area is lively and vibrant. The main hotel lift is very large and modern. The reception area is large but all furniture was shabby and uncomfortable and maintenance was overdue on the odd chair or more. The tiny area used for the breakfasts is not adequate for the number of clientele however I suggest what was available was not worth 12 Euro PP. A Macdonalds is at the other end of Rue de La Harpe, a Boulangerie and Paterisserie is around the corner and across the road next to Chez Clement the gorgeously kitsch Happy Days Diner had a wonderful choice of basic meals, including breakfast, for extremely good prices. A hearty breakfast for 2 there would not cost 12 Euros. We had a dinner at Chez Clement and at Happy Days and both meals were perfect whilst going from one end of the spectrum to the other price wise and the diverse decor at both venues was lovely. I recommend both. The St Michel area is a very easy Tourist location due to the St Michel Metro/RER links, and proximity to the Seine, Notre Dame, and numerous other easily accessible sites. It is perfect for walking around and by following the Seine and crossing the many ponts the majority of must see Paris monuments and museums etc., will be reached.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, room slightly larger than average”
Reviews.Author: RossOttawa
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance of Notre Dame, lots of good restaurants, near St Michel Metro. Deluxe double room with wrap-around balcony with table and two chairs on each side of the wraparound was very comfortable. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel cat (Isis) sleeps all day in the middle of the couch in the lobby and appears to be in charge of the operation. Breakfast, as is usual in Europe, was expensive so we went to a great bakery just around the corner. A bit noisy in the evening but not bad considering location. WiFi was available at 5 Euros for 48 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: afmachado
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a marvellous location, near the Quartier Latin, Notre Dame, Boulevard Saint Michel and Sena River. There is a Velib bike point in front of the hotel, making your transportation in Paris easier. The double room is quite simple and small, but very clean and confortable for a 2 star hotel. Because of the location, the rooms tend to be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall leaves much to be desired, particularly given the prices. Our room was musty, our bathroom small, and overall it was a rather dismal, uninspired place. However, we opted to pay more for a room with a balcony, which was its saving grace. Eating baguettes and brie and drinking wine out there was perfect, as was the location.

Reviews.Title: “More Than We Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: Linnybee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights in Paris at the Hotel Europe Saint Severin. We were extremely happy with our stay and would definately not hesitate to stay there again in the future. The location is excellent! The hotel is convenientely located on a charming pedestrian street in the latin quarter (5th Arrondisement). There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding area. We ate at a restaurant close to the hotel every night we were there. We even tried the restaurant just off the hotel, it was good Italian food - the pizzas and pastas were delicious. Some of the restaurants in the area can feel a little touristy or tacky, there seems to be nicer restaurants just a block over in the St. Germain district, again extremely close to the hotel. The metro station is literally around the corner from the hotel and has metro and RER service. Also, the Seine River and Notre Dame Cathedral are about a two minute walk from the hotel. We absolutely loved the location, right in the heart of everything. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, they all spoke fluent english. The hotel seems clean and modernized with a large (for Paris) elevator that can easily hold 4 adults comfortably. Our room was a decent size with a decent sized bathroom with shower. My husband and I are tall (6'-1 and 5'-9 respectively) and we didn't feel crampt. The bed was very comfortable after a long day exploring the city. The only draw backs were minor, the air conditioner really didn't work at all, it just spat out drops of water and made noise but, we never contacted the front desk about it so, it may have just been out of order. Also, the walls are quite thin (you can hear your neighbours talking) but, we were lucky in the fact that we didn't have noisey neighbours and I think thin walled hotels are pretty common in Paris. Overall we were extremely happy with the Hotel Europe, it was great value for money, we would stay there again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends. It really added to a very enjoyable time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: lvitsa
Reviews.Content: As most European Hotels have small rooms, we weren't expecting much. On arrival we were offered an upgrade for a small charge. The regular room was larger than we expected, but the suite was iresistable. The staff, especially Anna, were extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant was excellent as was the staff there. 10% discount at the restaurant, if you're staying at the hotel. Perfect location, right around the corner from Notre Dame, metro 1/2 block away. It is a busy street, but we were never bothered by noise. The best hotel we've stayed at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and facilities lacking!”
Reviews.Author: hobnobsmausi
Reviews.Content: Although I loved the location and access to the metro.... there were some problems. Firstly, we dropped off our bags and the front desk person directed me to a park house they recommend. The streets she told me to take were ONE WAY in the wrong direction. Fortunately I know the area so managed to find another way. Secondly, she neglected to tell me that they had a special rate/deal with the park house and I had to tell the garage when I parked. This resulted in me paying almost DOUBLE for the parking and also prevented me from taking the car in and out (which would also have been possible). Next there was the room, supposedly a double deluxe, but not so big at all. Only two electric plugs in the entire room which mean no recharge for a mobile phone while watching TV or using the refrigerator. We paid extra for internet, but it was not working. I telephoned the front desk and the guy seemed really irritated that I had to call him twice. Also, the maid came and woke us up Sunday morning because she wanted to make up the room. We asked her to go away. Later the telephone rang and it was the housekeeper calling to ask us if they could come, again they woke us up. We requested they leave the towels outside of the door, but again the maid came and woke us up later. Granted it was later in the day, but we were out all night and wanted to sleep. The price of 179euro per night was not SO good, but again the location made me like the place, I just wish the staff gave better information and was a bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Tres tres bien!!!”
Reviews.Author: JadoreVACATIONS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year during summer. The hotel location is great, near the train, the restaurants – easy access to everywhere. The most unforgettable about this hotel, is the kindness of its staff – especially Dominic (I apologized if I spelt your name incorrectly). He is such a nice person and tried really hard to accommodate us. FYI, we were sooo smart that we didn’t book any hotel in Paris (as we thought that “there’s gonna be a lot of hotel in Paris”) but we were dead wrong. (it was summer & apparently lots of people like to go to Paris during summer) We were walking & walking like mad couple looking for hotels with our 2 big luggage. Finally we ended up at this Hotel. There were no rooms in the hotel at that moment, but Dominic helped us & actually made us felt very safe. He said only 1 room will be available the next day, so we agreed & paid the deposit & he let us to leave our gigantic luggage in the storage. And we strolled all night long in Paris, just walking & had endless coffee/tea/juice because we had no place to sleep that night & we didn’t want to sleep at the lobby as that would make Dominic look bad & we were aware it’s a hotel not a wellfare…LOL. But we actually had fun walking at night in Paris. It was cold & tiring but at the same time it was lovely. The hotel ‘s room was nice but I think it was pretty small. But of course we were really thankful we had a room to stay. I definitely like the location. And they have this cute cat!!! If we ever come to Paris again, I’d definitely stay in this hotel again (will make early reservation though..haha) . To Dominic, keep up the good work !!! You saved our life!!! Merci beacoup Monsieur Dominic!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the end of July. We had probably the smallest room in all of Paris. Some of the reviews talk of refurbished rooms but we did not seem to have one of those. The room was extremely small...we had room to walk around the bed. However, the room was clean. The wall coverings looked a bit dated. The bathroom was clean..the shower had a door and good hot water. We did have a balcony so that helped. The balcony looked over St. Severin a main tourist street. We were on the 5th floor and did not hear any noise once the balcony doors were closed. The room did have airconditioning...although not quite to US standards but it did help to keep the room cool. There was a stocked refridgerator that we kept some water in. All that said, we did really enjoy the area and were only in the room to rest or sleep. The staff were very helpful and nice. They arranged at Yellow Shuttle van for us back to the airport. Right on time. Really close to RER and METRO stations. We did not have breakfast at hotel but it shares a room with the Pizza Restaurant (Pizza was excellent). We would stay here again but probably would get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Met every expectation and more - plan to return”
Reviews.Author: CookieDartmouth
Reviews.Content: We had heard that hotel rooms in Paris were small - but the deluxe double at Hotel Europe St Severin was generously sized and well equipped. Room for two adults to do yoga. We paid a little extra to get the deluxe double, and since we were staying almost two weeks, we were given one of the refurbished rooms. I believe that everyone who works there is so accomodating that if you ask in advance, as we did, to have one of the renovated rooms, you will get one. It was not noisy. We never heard a conversation or even a vacuum cleaner. Our windows were double paned, which was good, because Quartier Latin is noisy - although that's why we chose it. We saw street performances of all kinds from our window. The surrounding area has every kind of restaurant imaginable in low to medium price ranges, and better restaurants within short walking distance (it's practically in San Germaine des Pres - it's literally less than a block from the St Michel Metro and it really is 10-12 minutes leisurely walk to Notre Dame's interior). There is a boulangerie around the corner, a mini-mart one block a way, a Monoprix two blocks away, and a refrigerator in the room. We had a nice sized closet and a good sized, ergonomically designed bathroom. I asked for a tub with hand shower and that was lovely. We had a balcony (two of them actually) with two small tables and four chairs. The elevator was big by Parsian standards, but the delightful curving staircase was lovely to use as well. The 10E breakfast was better than any nearby café breakfast, although the cafés are fun. There's an internet café a block away and wifi in the lobby (it may reach to the rooms, we didn't try to use it). The staff is so kind and really looks out for you. The bed linens are superior, better than most American motels/hotels. They have wood floors, very good for those of us with allergies. Everything was very clean. Check-in was literally 1 minute. Taxis were arranged and completely on time. Service was personal but never intrusive. Other residents included college athletes and their coaches, people from other parts of France, several groups of Spaniards, and many Brits and Americans. The interior decor was charming and it really is centrally located - about two blocks from the Cluny Medieval Museum, 15 minutes leisurely walk to Rue Moufettard or the Pantheon, very close to all the wonderful cafés and shopping of Boulevard San Germain - and near the Seine. To us, the combination of balcony, accordian music or clarinetist, crisp linens, beautifully painted room with some exposed stone walls was quite romantic. There is parking nearby/underneath if anyone wanted that. There's a quite decent Italian restaurant on the first floor and the staff made wonderful recommendations for other places up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0nier
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best possible location for sightseeing in Paris: - 1 min walk (literally) to metro / RER station (direct line to Charles de Gaulle airport, 35 min ride) - 3 min walk to Notre Dame de Paris, as well as to the stop for 3 lines (green, orange and blue) of sightseeing tour buses - 5 min walk to Seine river cruises (Vedettes du Pont-Neuf) - 10 min walk to Jardin du Luxembourg, Pantheon - 20 min walk to Musée du Louvre - In the heart of the Latin Quarter (tons of restaurants, pedestrian streets, live performance). Hotel itself is small but very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful, everyone at front desk spoke English. All rooms are of slightly different size, so I guess it is matter of luck which one you get. Our room was small, but comfortable enough for 2 persons. It had AC, LCD TV, and big bathroom with large bath tab. Windows were overlooking small street with restaurants, Saturday night it was a bit noisy over there, but after closing windows (turned on AC for the night) we did not hear noise at all. Room had few scratches on the floor and walls, but was very clean. It also had mini bar in a small fridge. We did not have a chance to try Italian restaurant at the hotel, but once had a dinner in the small French restaurant across the street (named Lemenhir) and both food and wine were excellent. For breakfasts we went to small patisserie on the corner of Rue de la Harpe and Rue de la Hachette for freshly baked croissants and coffee. The only cons is the price - but all hotels are expensive in Paris, and here you pay for good hotel at the best location.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ColetteFC
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples at the hotel. We all enjoyed our stay. We appreciated the location. It was at a walking distance to all major attractions. Clean room with comfortable bed, recently renovated bathroom, good size shower with plenty of hot water, refrigerator and safe in the room, acceptable size room with closet and cupboards for storage. Large lift, computer in lobby (10 Euros for one week, unlimited use), friendly and helpful personnel at front desk. We had a room facing the street (on 4th floor). We didn't hear the noise from the street if we closed the window and the curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: StefBec
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! It's only a few blocks from the Metro and walking distance to Notre Dame. The neighborhood is very active with many restaurants and bars. The staff were very friendly and speak English. The hotel has an elevator and a cat that lives in the lobby. Ask for a room overlooking the street. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Location and value!”
Reviews.Author: kmcmom2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. Booked two rooms, one for my college age sons and one for my mother and myself. Newly renovated with exposed stone and brick. Hardwood floors. Airconditioning. Beautiful tiled bathroom. No balcony, but were able to open up the french door style windows (floor to ceiling) and sit on the chairs in the room to sip wine and watch the world go by after dinner. Very lively area with tons of sidewalk tables to eat at with nightly performances by jugglers, kick boxing demonstrations, and quartets. Not boisterous, just enough energy to make it interesting. Elevator was useful, breakfast was good, staff spoke English. Only downside was that our taxi driver had a problem finding where to drop us off, as the street is pedestrian only. When we were leaving the hotel desk called a cab for us, and it was able to get to the front of the hotel to pick us up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: GoneSouth10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this quaint hotel for four nights. Location was the primary factor for us as my wife had never been to Paris and she wanted to experience the essence of the city - and it delivered! The room we had was small, even by European standards, but clean and comfortable. Because we were starting out on a four week trip, we had a LOT of luggage, so that made the room a little cramped. However, it's Paris, so we weren't looking to spend time in the room anyway. BTW, the rooms are not standardized, and I think we may have ended up in one of the smaller rooms (at least that's what it looked like from the floor plan). Also, we got a room with a balcony, which helped. The neighborhood is great with a lot of food choices (although stay away from the tourist spots between the hotel and the Seine!) and very convenient Metro and RER stops that will put you anywhere you need to go in Paris. The Louvre, Notre Dame, Ile St. Loius, the Sorbonne, Jardin du Luxembourg (and many other sights) are all within easy strolling distance, with the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, etc, reachable by a more ambitious, but certainly do-able, walk. Overall, if you don't mind the tight quarters, this is a great hotel and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: sadde1
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location!!! In the heart of the Latin Quarter, close to many restaurants, 3 minutes from the Notre Dame, 1 minute from the Metro, simply a perfect location. Location is the biggest asset of this hotel! The rooms are small, clean and basic. A small bathroom+shower with hot water, a TV and a (free) safe. On the second floor, the rooms have a balcony. There is an elevator, so no need to carry your bags up the stairs. The breakfast is very basic. It's OK, but you can find much better in one of the coffees nearby. There is an air condition in the rooms, but ours didn't work even after we called main desk to fix it. We managed without it, but in the winter or summer, it better work! The room is a little noisy, there are a lot of emergency vehicles passing in Boulevard Saint-Michel and you can hear them in the room. The walls are thin and you can hear some noises from other rooms. It's not too loud and after walking all day, we slept like babies and noise didn't bother us. The corridor smells! It's probably the old carpets or the wooden walls. No smell in the room. There is also an internet corner (not free). The staff was friendly and helpful. We came to the room to shower and sleep, for that, it is a great hotel in a fabulous location, and with a fair price. It's a 2 stars hotel, with 2-3 stars facilities, 2-3 stars price and 5 stars location.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: mkhtx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Europe Saint Severin Nov. 22-27th, 2008. It was our first trip to Paris, so I spent literally hours researching hotels before deciding to book this one. I was pleased with our choice. The room had a small balcony with a little table and chairs. It was well-organized for a small room. There were shelves in the closet for storage. The bathroom was updated, with a shower, clean tile, and room to put things on 2 shelves. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, but it was clean and just right for a couple. The mini-frig was restocked every day, and the prices were very reasonable on the drinks. We never got up in time for the breakfast, so I can't comment on that. We visited the pizza/Italian restaurant next door....very busy on a Saturday afternoon, when we arrived. We also visited Lutece restaurant (on St. Michel, less than a block away). Liked both restaurants, and they were kind about our pitiful French! The staff at the hotel was always friendly. You do have to leave your key at the front desk each time you leave the building, but it was never a problem....there is always someone on duty. Noise was a small problem only one night......there was a family with a baby next door, and we could hear almost every word. They were gone the next day, though, so it was quiet the rest of the time. Noise from the street did not seem to be a problem...the sound-proofed windows sealed it out. Great base for exploring....several metro stops nearby.....however, be careful to note that they can be confusing with similar names. When we arrived from CDG (took RER B), we literally walked around about 30 minutes before we found our hotel, even though it was probably only a block or so away.....just kinda confusing. Notre Dame (my favorite sight in Paris!) is VERY close, and we walked there several times at night and during the day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem with great location”
Reviews.Author: FlipperEastCoast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Saint Severin twice and have not been disappointed. Most recently I took my teenage daughter to Paris over Chirstmas. It is a block from the RER and we were able to check-in early after our flight arrived - thank goodness. The hotel staff was quite friendly and full of suggestions. We were greeted by Isis, the hotel cat, whom my daughter developed quite a relationship! By the end of the week, Isis had followed us to our room - much to my daughter's delight. We stayed on the 4th floor with a window to the street (dec 2007) - traveler's pictures are quite accurate. This room was small but adequate, besides we spent our time outside traveling to all the sites and shopping. It was quiet and there was no odor of smoke. We skipped the hotel breakfast and ate at several of the close by cafe's and crepe stands. In December of 2004, I stayed in a single room on the second floor - I had requested non-smoking, but that means if you are not smoking in the room it is non-smoking. The room on the second floor had a nice balcony, but was located above the restaurant which made for a noisy night. A highlight of the trip over Christmas 2007 was to walk to midnight mass at St. Severin. The hotel has been in the process of upgrading the hallways since my stay in 2004 and was still being worked on in 2007, but I never heard any noise as did other travelers. The location is central to sightseeing in Paris and I can't wait to talk my other daughter for her first trip to Paris too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Excellent & Perfect”
Reviews.Author: k1rst_l
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on Friday 9th Jan and checked in with a lovely and very helpful man on reception. His English was very good. We asked about anywhere near by for food even though it was near to midnight and he immediately went next door to speak to the adjoining pizza restaurant that were closing and managed to get us a table. The food and wine there was great and the staff very pleasant and helpful even though we were keeping them from closing. The hotel was newly decorated and the hallways and staircase were lovely. The room was perfect & again well decorated & clean. We were on the top floor and had a small balcony also which added to the charm. On Saturday morning we needed to find a certain bank and spoke with the lady on reception. Again her English was very good and she bent over backwords to help us and found the nearest branch and called them up and spoke to them about our query and translated the response. She then gave us a map and directions and off we went. The hotel is in a great location and surrounded by great restaurants and bars and near to metro. On Saturday evening another gentleman on reception called us a taxi and was again very pleasant and helpful. On Sunday, we were called in the room at 11.30 (check out time) but we did not get down til just after 12 but they were fine and not at all moody like some places can be and they looked after our luggage all day. After travelling all over the world, I can say that all in all, this is definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in! We went on the free walking tour in the afternoon which is highly recommended and starts just around the corner from the hotel. We also saw Le Lido show which was just wonderful and again highly recommended. Thank you for adding a pleasant stay to our thoroughly wonderful weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Michael12358
Reviews.Content: Noise is a problem here - from building renovation work during the day, and other guest rooms at night. They are removing carpeting from some bedrooms for the authentic parisian look but if you're underneath these rooms, like we were, the LOUD footfall and scraping chairs etc is highly intrusive at night. General denial that there's a problem but otherwise friendly staff, excellent location on one of the pedestrian streets in the heart of the Latin Quarter, good decor, and rooms clean but small (even the superior we paid extra for barely fitted in the bed). Wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Place in a Foreign City”
Reviews.Author: Datonabeach
Reviews.Content: This was our first time traveling to Paris and we were not sure what to expect. We reviewed the comments of others and decided on this hotel. Upon arrival at CDG my luggage was lost. There is no control over the claim process, so be sure your luggage is promentally marked. This situation was explained at the front desk upon arrival to the young lady in charge, Soleil , who took complete charge of retriving the luggage from a woman who mistakingly took the wrong bag. She took this task upon herself and followed up to happy conclusion. The hotel is in the final stages of renovations. The room we had (#206) was refurbished with a new bath ,new furniature, and repainted. The halls were being carpeted and the walls were being touched up. They are doing a nice job of restoring this 18th century property. The neighborhood is in great location . The Metro is around the corner and RER is across the street from there. Taxie stand is there too. The area is loaded with Bars and restaurants of various ethnic types, with the traditional French dominating. The hotel has a good breakfast service(10E). The best part is the hostess who is friendly and willing to help you with your french langague skills.... The room we selected had a balcony which provided an extra deminsion of interest to our stay. The insulated windows provide soundproofing , as it is noisey at night with the busy restaurants and bars. This is an excellent tourist hotel for anyone who wants to be in the heart of the action of Paris. I recommend this hotel highly. P.S. Thank You Again Soleil

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: esjac
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for us to stay in. It was in a great location - very central. We were very happy with our room -it was modern, clean, great bed, amazing view, perfect size. However, our friend got a room that had not yet been reburbished. Therefore my advice is when booking make sure you get a brand new room. I would also recommend staying in the marais area if you are still deciding.

Reviews.Title: “A good sized room”
Reviews.Author: lelanni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from 25/08. Last year stayed at the Albe just around the corner. Booked a superior double inc breakfast for £280 through active hotels, Room was much more spacious than Albe, a proper double bed ,lovely white duvet and 2 pillows each. Safe, Sky TV and B.B.C. World . mini bar. Had room 318 next to elevator but not disturbed. Breakfast ,we felt was good considering the prices elsewhere, a pot of tea each, orange juice, cereal, fresh fruit salad, ham , cheese , croissants, bread, jams, hard boiled eggs-enough to keep us going till 2-3 p.m. Reception ,pleasant and good on security. Cleaners , very efficient and friendly / Room overlooked back and I wish that I had paid the difference to get a balcony- they are proper balconies with table and chairs and I could have watched the world go by whilst beloved had his 2hr nap (!) Bathroom was small but with a shower screen - if you are more than a size 16 , check the size of the bathroom by e- mailing them- they speak english and will reply promptly. Smoking allowed! Paris very expensive- 4.6 euros for a cup of tea, wine 4-10 euros for a small glass, bring a bottle opener and get wine from a supermarket. Two scams in Paris- Person stops you and asks if you have dropped a gold wedding ring- once you have stopped they ask for money- 2nd one person is giving out what looks like free advertising paper. if you take one they let you walk about 10 paces and then accuse you of not paying, they refuse to take the paper back and you end up giving them 2 euros

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scotties2
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights, the location is great, right bang in the middle of the Latin Quarter with so many restaurants and bars. 10 minutes walk from Notre-dam and 5 minutes from the Seine. Hotel was OK, we had a superior room with balcony on the 5th floor, to say it was small was an understatement, the bathroom was tiny and you definately couldn't swing a cat in it. But for the money it was clean and the sound proofing was really good considering the location and the staff were very friendly, especially the hotel Cat. The breakfast at 10 Euros wasn't worth it, we only took it one day and then went outside after that. It was really easy to get to from Airport, Metro straight to Saint Michel and then a 5 minute walk, but be warned it isn't very well signed and we spent ages finding it, we unfortunately went into the Latin quarter and should have stuck to Rue Saint Michel where it is one block from the Seine and about 10mtrs down Saint Severin. Good tip, you should do the L'open top bus for 2 days, at 32 Euros each it seems a lot, but it is worth every penny, there are 4routes you can take and they cover everywhere of main interest in Paris and you can jump on and off whenever you want, with full commentary, if you upgrade this ticket to the A la carte at 39 Euros you can also use the river boats. The buses run every 10 minutes and have various pickup and dropoff points all around the city. On the whole we had a great time, very expensive as the £ isn't doing well against the Euos, our dearest cup of coffee was 5.50 Euros. Coupe in 50's from Scoland

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McQCrew
Reviews.Content: Rented two rooms for my family of 4--a superior double and standard twin. Overall the hotel was much better than expected for a 2 star property! I also had 4 business associates that stayed here with me and they were all very pleased with the hotel. There is still some renovation going on so sometimes it was a little noisy during the day, but then we weren't spending the daytime in our rooms! The room's renovation seemed complete, and they were very nice--the double was very large for a typical European hotel room and the twin was a good sized. The beds in both were excellent. The location is outstanding--around the corner from 2 metro/RER lines, easy walking distance to Notre Dame and many other sites (we do a lot of walking, and even the Louvre was an easy walk). it is surrounded by an enormous number of restaurants--we found oursleves returning to the area for dinner very night just due to the broad variety and quality of restaurants. The streets are very active at night, providing a lot of entertainment, but the rooms were quiet enough to sleep well. The hotel staff were all courteous and extremely helpful too. Overall this is a very good hotel and great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: et-toronto
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Latin quarter - although can be noisy on a weekend night - into the wee hours.
