Our room was larger than most and we had a lovely oval bath tub (a rare find in Paris) with separate w/c. The bathroom was small otherwise. The staff were very helpful. The hotel seemed to be under construction which we were not made aware of, but it did not infringe our stay. The breakfast was expensive, but it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HelenaLisbon
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here a long time ago: December 2005! Ooopss.... Good things about this hotel: good price, small walking distance from the train and metro (Saint Michel station), very central (Notre Dame is very close), many budget restaurants around the corner. Bad things: the room and bathroom are very small, so if you need a lot of space for you and your luggage... forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LDP98
Reviews.Content: I am so glad to have found this hotel through TripAdvisor! This was my 7th time in Paris, and my best hotel experience yet. I have stayed in both fancier and crappier Paris hotels, but what made this average hotel great was the helpful staff and fun location. Throughout the week, there was just one receptionist, so it was easy to establish a relationship with her. She was so patient with my French abilities - with other Americans and Brits she spoke English - and I got lots of conversational practice as she helped track my father's lost luggage from AirFrance! She advised a nearby inexpensive store to buy him replacement clothes, and kept me updated on the status of the luggage delivery. When it finally arrived, she remembered which of our two rooms was my father's and had the bag waiting for him in his room when we returned from siteseeing. This was my elderly parents' first time in Paris, and I was nervous that the Latin Quarter location might be too loud for them. It was no problem, however, as the thick walls and windows kept out the noise. But actually they loved the bustling neighborhood anyway! We didn't use the nearby subway, as it's not wheelchair accessible for my mom, but the location allowed for easy strolls to the Roman bathhouse ruins at the Cluny, the St. Severin church, and even Notre Dame and St. Chappelle. We used the neighborhood taxi stand to travel longer distances.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: Paulapie50
Reviews.Content: I am not sure all the reviews are true on this hotel. The beds are comfortable, but as an asthmatic feather pillows and duvets are a no no and they could not accomodate me with syntethic ones so i was wheezy all weekend, plus it is clean but a bit old and dusty which didnt help me at all. The hall areas leading off to the bedrooms are disgraceful to be honest and could do with a major overhall.. The reception area is nice but small and they do good Pizza in the restaurant.. Its also an easy to find place.... Originally we had a refurbished room which was a shoebox and dusty even though newly done( Bizzare!!). We moved rooms as i wasnt happy with the first one, but I had only asked for the room to be cleaned, we were told that was not possible so they moved us to one that was not refurbished and it was dreadful: bigger, dirtier and a bit sad looking (point of story dont change rooms you will be punished)..but at least we could walk around the room without falling over the bed like in the reburbished one. The old room also had a shower that you could stand up in as the reburbished room there was only a bath and a hose and no shower curtain so you would have to sit in the bath, not very practical really.. If your staying make sure its on the 2nd floor so you can get a balcony otherwise its not good value and the rooms are also a little biggger on that floor ..They seem to be proud of that floor, maybe its the only one truly finished..we obviously were no where near this floor... I thought the staff were stressed out, overworked and a little rude, but I suppose thats Paris. All in all I dont think the hotel was good value and was a bit dissapointed as the reviews made the place seem like it would be good value and at the most I expected it to be clean, friendly and comfortable which I am sad to say wasnt any of these. It was in an ok location but I have to say their are nicer ones if you are on a budget like i was. St Severin is a little cheesy, all mediocre french restaurants that overcharge you (beware the free drinks) and full of pickpockets..Also beware of sitting outside to eat in this area, my mobile was stolen from a restauarant table and it was gone so quick I have no idea who took it...my partner was convinced it was the waiter!!!!! You really need to watch your posscesions in Paris, I think it is worse now than Barcelona which seemed to be the consensus of other travelers we met. You can get better in Paris for 150 euro a night...its less than a 2 star in our eyes...and if i went back to Paris I would be staying in a different location.... most likely near the St Germain area where you get a better class of restaurants for a better price...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: TamlinVisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the end of March with friends, and enjoyed it. After navigating the murky world of Paris hotels at fairly late notice I was relieved to have chosen a goody. I really just want to reiterate points made in previous entries; - location superb - staff friendly and welcoming - rooms pleasant, clean, nice showers with ready hot water, slept well - note that no kettles or irons (this is normal for europe apparently) Remember that it is a 2 star, so there are no extra frills. As of end of march renovations have progressed, paint smell has gone, but for those who really care about their corridors; the carpets in the halls are showing the signs of the work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: andyb949
Reviews.Content: This is a two star hotel, so if you want luxury you should look elsewhere. What it is is a charming place in a brilliant location. My single room was very small (and the bathroom was absolutely tiny), but did have a double bed and I also had a balcony overlooking the street below. As it was a busy area this meant I could hear noise from outside, but it was never enough to be disruptive. My room had a safe, but no kettle. Decor was okay, although the corridors were being done up as I was there. The hotel's main selling point is its location. Notre Dame is down the end of the road; the Louvre a pleasant fifteen minute walk along the Seine (perfect for getting there early and beating the queues); and the Jardin du Luxembourg ten minuters in the other direction. The Metro station on the corner has limited lines (although does include Gare Du Nord and the two airports), so make the five minute walk across the river to the Chatelet station and you will be far better served. The immediate vicinity has hundreds of cafes, bars and restaurants and very lively, bustling atmosphere. There's so much to do in Paris at night, but you can waste whole evenings just wandering around the area eating crepes and watching the musicians and other performers in the streets. The hotel was good value and the staff, as others have said, excellent. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 50 yds from a Metro station, with lots of cafes, restaurants, and shops in easy walking distance. We had a Superior room, which although small, was well decorated and generally clean, and despite looking over a busy road, the room was quiet. However, the carpet in the room was very worn and dirty, and the corridor to our room was being redecorated during our stay (as was every other corridor in the hotel). Therefore, the room reeked of paint (no one thought to open the corridor windows!!), and we were woken up on two occasions at ~8am with hammering and sandpapering. Despite several comments to the reception people and the manager, and their offer of another room, nothing was done to improve this aspect of our stay. Saying that, the staff were friendly and polite, and when we arrived to find our none-smoking room actually had a dual role as the hotel's ashtray, they were quick to offer us several alternatives. Overall, if we return to Paris on a budget, this hotel might be worth revisiting, but there are better areas to stay in and much nicer looking hotels if you're prepared to do the hunting on-line. And book early!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WindyCiteTraveler
Reviews.Content: General review the same as everyone else re: size, location and generally friendly staff. No safe, radio or balcony with my room. Did periodically get cigarette smoke and noise from another room. (Bring ear plugs, room freshener and play television as needed.) Before adding my words of advice, I must add that knowing what I know now, I would consider staying there again since I now have all the information I need. With the remainder of my review, I will share information to help you know what you need to know now. 1.) After checking in, you will be shown where they serve breakfast. This DOES NOT mean that breakfast is free. At this point they charge 10 Euros a day which seems expensive (bread, jelly, cut up fruit, ham, cheese, yogurt, coffee and juice). You are better off eating at a bakery. 2.) They supposedly can arrange shuttle service to and from Charles de Gaulle airport but most did not seem to know that. Your best bet is to take the train, so pack lightly. It is risky to arrange a shuttle through them since there really is no guarantee that they will follow through. But now you know. A cab ride is another option though expensive, around 55 Euros. 3.) Last, but NOT least, stay away from rooms ending with "18" or you will be next to the noisy elevator. Unless something is available that day, you will have to wait (have fun sleeping). FYI, for yoga and meditation classes, rasa-yogarivegauche.com is within walking distance. Take St. Germain direction opposite Seine, turn left on St. Germain and then left on St. Jacques. Also while there is a small grocery store down the street, take St. Michele (away from direction of Seine) to St. Germain and cross street. One of the side streets has a great grocery store. Good prices for food, wine and candy bars. Okay, this is more than just info. about hotel but should enrich your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: surpasspro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europe saint severin at the beginning of September and found it to be a great hotel. Its only a couple of block from the RER train station and since I was taking that train from the airport, it worked out. If you carrying a lot of bags the train my be a pain, so get a taxi. The room we had was #602 with nice space and a big bathroom. I looked at the floor plan in the hallway and all the rooms in the hotel seem to be different sizes. Some are really small and others really big. Ours was on the larger size. The bed was really comfortable and we slept well. We didn’t have a balcony, but didn’t need it since you can open up the windows and see out. Since we stayed on the 6th floor we had to take the elevator up to the 5th and carry our luggage up a flight. I think that is only for certain room on the 6th floor not all of them, so if that’s a problem you should ask about it. The hallways are under construction, but it wasn’t a big deal for us. Also, yes, it is noisy outside since of the location. We were tired from walking around and after we fell asleep we didn’t get woken up by the noise. After a certain hour everyone goes to sleep. The location was great, since it is only a couple of blocks from notre dame. From there we walked to the louvre and so on. So the hotel was a good launch pad to start site seeing. There was no lack of restaurants and shops around. We ate breakfast at a bakery around the corner. The location was great and our room was nice for the price… I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, fantastic balcony”
Reviews.Author: SETDalkeyIreland
Reviews.Content: My (23 year-old) son and I have just returned from a great weekend in Paris. I found Hotel Europe-St. Séverin through Trip Advisor and was attracted first of all by the location; I emailed the hotel directly after I booked asking if possible to have a room with a balcony. Our experience there was all we hoped and more. The location couldn't be more convenient and vibrant (travellers who get upset by street noise should go somewhere else - like the middle of the countryside!) Dozens of restaurants literally on the doorstep, the Seine 50 meters away, metro station, river boat, major sites ditto. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and nice, and our 5th floor balcony was simply fantastic. I recommend Hotel Europe-St. Séverin to anybody wanting an authentic and memorable Paris experience. sue.tulk@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1998
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated in the Quartier Latin and the RER line to CDG airport which is the reason my partner and I chose it. It is easy to walk to the major sites: Notre-Dame, Ile de la Cité, the Louvre, the Beaubourg, the Marais, Saint Germain des Près, etc. Other reviewers have noted that the hotel is noisy because of the location and that is true but we came prepared with earplugs. So thanks to everyone else who has contributed a review! The hotel has been recently renovated and there is still some finishing work to do in the halls, but the decor of the rooms is great. Clean, clean, clean. We had a room with a balcony so were able to spend some time just watching the street life and that was fun. Staff was helpful. Breakfast was good. Isis the cat added her own brand of aloof charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewinMiami
Reviews.Content: First, the location is excellent - RER to St Michel and 2 minutes from the station entrance. The elevator can take 4 people and luggage comfortably - most in Paris are postage stamp size but then the buildings are from the 1800's so PLEASE don't compare to any US chain hotels. I have stayed here twice and the bathrooms are above average Parisian downtown hotel size and quite clean. Again, this is Paris not USA so don't try and compare. I had a 5th floor room with balcony this time. Yes it can get noisy at night but then you are close to the center of the tourist dining area. My room had A/C which kept the room fresh with the windows closed. The only downside is no wireless internet in the rooms and the service in the lobby is poor. However, often you can catch a stray unsecured signal. ISIS, the cat, makes up for the internet to some degree. PS if you can speak some French, use it - the receptionists do appreciate the effort!

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations, fanatastic location”
Reviews.Author: Keefucious
Reviews.Content: Above all, this hotel is in an excellent location and close to all the major sites. We loved it for that. I had requested a 2nd floor balcony and was happy that we got i because our room (216) was a double and fairly small. The bathroom was spotless and had a standup shower with good water pressure. The bed was comfortable , and the pillows good, the room had working air conditioning (but we didn't need it). The doors to the balcony open up, and we did leave those open at night, and yes, it was a little noisy but we expected that in this location which we knew was busy. The noise was there, but it didn't bother us. Te staff was extremely friendly and very accomodating. They spoke english with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great quaint place, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: jfburkhart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference meeting. It was a terrific spot with very polite reception staff. The breakfast staff is another story! The breakfast is also not included... and very basic (but the bread is delicious as are the croissants, but aren't they all in Paris?). It was in the process of being partially renovated.. or it's just not up to very high standards... the hallways were a little dirty it seemed. All in all, the location is great, if you want to be in the HEART of the latin quarter, and the rooms despite being over a busy night scene street are quiet (good windows). We had a small balcony which was nice. The bathroom was nice, clean, but not spotless (some mold high on the tiles in the shower). Would recommend it as a safe bet, but nothing that will completely overwhelm someone special... might be back... but probably would take a chance on exploring some other properties (there are hundreds) in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but loud”
Reviews.Author: Rusty_Jones
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for two nights in June. A lot of the things about this hotel were great. The staff were friendly and courteous, the room was large, comfortable and spotlessy clean, the location is brilliant - minutes away from St Michael station and within walking distance of most top attractions - and the service was excellent. We had to postpone our departure to Paris due to illness, so called the hotel the morning we were due to go to see if we were able to cancel our first night. Not only did they let us do so without charge, but when we arrived a day late, they had upgraded us to a deluxe room. But that was the problem... The room looked fabulous - when you look at pictures of the hotel exterior, it's the one on the second floor, with the balcony wrapping around the front of the building. We were very excited about sitting out on our little table and watching the bustling street below. However, at night, the noise from the street was immense. I am renowned for being able to sleep through anything, and although I could drop off ok, I was continually woken up - and that was with all the windows closed. Drunken partygoers scream and shout until about 3am - which is fair enough, we were there at the weekend. But then, from about 4am, the street cleaners come out in force and start banging about empty bottles and rattling shop-front grilles. This, coupled with strange bangings from inside the hotel led to two very tired and grumpy people each morning. Other reviewers say that noise wasn't a problem, so I'm guessing it was just this room, which I think was number 203. Unfortunately though, it's enough to put me off staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “what's that smell?”
Reviews.Author: jcrew01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of hours in a room that had some strange mildewish like smell. When we went to the front desk to complain they suggested we open the windows. Gee, why didn't I think of that? So we did, for a couple of hours while we strolled around and had breakfast. When we got back the odor was even stronger. The front desk handed us a key and said try another room and see if it suits us. The room was one floor up directly above our old room. It seemed to be the source of the smell. The hotel appeared to be almost vacant and we had reservations for several days there, but they wouldn't think of upgrading us even though they put us through such an ordeal. It's almost as if they wanted us to leave. The rooms were extremely small and not very clean. If you're a student who plans to be too drunk to care about all the noise and smell, then this place is somewhat cheap.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: boo2U
Reviews.Content: We loved it!! my boyfriend and I started our French vacation with a one day lay-over in Paris before we continued onto to the French Riviera(Nice) I booked this in part because I wanted to go to church and didn't want any hassles on getting a cab , I just wanted to be within walking distance to Notre Dame. I decided on this hotel because of the advice from others on this site. I was very , very happy ...ok, the halls were under construction but who cares about the hallways.......the room was roomy, clean, comfortable and they gave us a room with a balcony, (I totally begged and begged when I made the reservation and again when I confirmed it and again when I got to the front desk) again, I knew to do that because of all the reviews about the balconies.....anyway, the bathroom was HUGE with a great shower....you could have had a party in that tub. there was a mini-bar, and the room was a good size for Paris, and at night we sat on the balcony drinking wine , It was perfect and the hotel staff was very friendly. We were in the center of things, with cafe's, and markets and as a side note, the hotel offers breakfast but we didn't purchase that because we were leaving the next morning pretty early on our way to Nice and don't eat that early, but we wouldn't have gotten it anyway because there are so many cafe's around ...everything was perfect . Also, although our room overlooked the street below, noise was never a problem. In my room on the 5th floor, there were no exposed wires like other people have mentioned, no single "lightbulbs just sticking out", there was none of that in our room...in the hallways, yes, but not in our room. I loved this hotel and would recommend this to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off! Misrepresented Dump with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DenverJerry
Reviews.Content: The room pictured was labeled as a triple room on their and Venere's site, but when we got there they said "sorry, although it says triple room (claimed a mistake after I showed them on my laptop because they did not believe me), it is a triple suite and you can't have it". This was especially disappointing in that they had erroneously canceled our reservation earlier (claimed computer error), we rebooked at a better rate which they also cancelled claiming another mistake (in rates). They called us to tell us the first cancellation was a mistake and still good after we had booked the better rate and said they would perhaps work with us when we arrived. I told them there was no need to work with us if they just gave us the room pictured on the site at the higher reservation rate. They agreed. The room we received was a dump with horrible beds and very little room (nothing like the pictured and promised room). The rooms, halls, etc. were very shabby with pulled up carpet, stains, thin walls, dust, dirt, and construction mess everywhere. Their attitude was that I was being unreasonable to expect the room pictured and promised at the promised rate and doubted that I had talked to anyone at the hotel (THEY CALLED ME to avoid the lower rate booked after they erroneously cancelled me). The location (area) was fantastic, so it is a shame the operators and their websites are such a fraud and a sham. I would have definitely booked another hotel when comparing if I knew their pictures were fraudulent and will never stay at this dump again. 2 star rating is a real stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: AnneliTallinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in February 2007 and will recommend it as a really great place to anyone looking for two star hotel that is super clean, cosy, friendly and located in the heart of Paris, just 2 minutes from Seine and Notre Dame. We have travelled a lot and could say the hotel can be ranked as 3 star hotel. While many hotels adverstising themselves at various net booking sites claim to have very central location but turn to be much more far from center, that particular hotel really is at great location. Its in most lovely Latin district, with tens of great restauraunts, some clubs and coffee shops around. The hotel was very clean and the staff, specially the young staff, was very friendly and helpful. With us they had some booking error at first but they fixed it very quickly and professionally. You can take you breakfast buffet for 10 euros in the hotel but we recommend to try also some local coffee shops just next street where you can get you hot fresh croissants and coffee for less price and feel more parisian and less tourist. And as its so close to Seine, have at least once the breakfast with you take-away-coffee-and-croissants sitting on river stairs next to Notre Dame. If you stay in the hotel we will also recommend you a lot to visit Latin Paradise cabaret show in the same region (some 15 min walk from the hotel and Notre Dame) that was absolutely great and is conisidered as one of the very best cabaret shows in Paris. We have seen several shows like that and it was really just great - very professional and also tasteful. Around the corner from the hotel great music was played at St. Michel street, starting 23 and lasting over hour on weekends. And once in Paris, check also the Notre Dame concert and mass times from net before you go - thats definately "must to do" at least once when you stay so close to ND. And one more tip - in case you arrive on Monday for a week or for long weekend, check the "carte orange" travel ticket that you can buy also at airport metro or RER station - the ticket for 1-5 zones that costed only 31 euros included return ticket from airport to Paris central, week long free travel in all Paris (all bus lines, metro and RER trains included) and even RER trip to Versailles, some Paris nearby areas, so its great to know that if you wish to see around. The hotel is located at very safe area and bus, metro, RER stops are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “super location”
Reviews.Author: chilenitaHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the new year weekend as it was one of the few hotels that still had available rooms. The location is great, right next to the metro, and some excellent restaurants in the st. germain area. The hotel is located right on the edge of the busy latin quartier, we had a room facing the street and had no noise problem. The hotel is being renovated inside. Our room had the bathroom new and finished, but the room was half way done. Our room was tiny, but clean with a little balcony. Its very basic. The hotel offers breakfast but it was not included in the price. We chose to get our morning coffee with croissant in one of the many cafes near by. (there is a starbucks around the corner). Overall basic hotel, great location, a bit expensive but for new year's weekend.... can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Saralondon
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel because of its great location. I know Paris well as I lived there for a year and knew this would be a great area to stay in. The hotel is just off Place St Michel, less than 5 minutes walk to Notre Dame and 5 minutes walk from the more upmarket Saint Germain area. The hotel itself is on a very touristy street, full of restaurants and as a result is always very lively. However, although our room overlooked the street, noise was never a problem. Considering this is a 2 star hotel, our room was great. The room was perfectly clean and a good size for Paris, the beds comfortable, TV, good sized wardrobe. The bathroom was completely clean and modern and seemed to have been recently installed. If you want a romantic break in a luxury hotel, this is not for you. If you want to make the most of being in Paris, its sights and nightlife, then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: hipappa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, excellent location bang in the middle to the Latin Quarter, all the sounds of Paris straight through your bedroom window, double glazing is exellent when you,ve heard enough. Air con very good, powerful shower. Hotel generally very clean and all staff friendly and helpful. I would use this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Love the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: bikes&boats
Reviews.Content: $239 per night. I forgot I paid that much, wow. But I can't complain too much cause it was a terrific location in the lovely latin quarter. It is tucked amongst small streets and not on a main plaza or boulevard. We stayed on the top floor so we had a quaint slanted ceiling and the bed was on a raised platform. The room wasn't that small by Paris standards. It was a "Superior Double Room" according to my Expedia reservation. I later found out I could have saved some money by making the reservation directly with the hotel. The mattress was large enough for two but it was kinda flat. Not sure how old it might have been. The bath was in the room so everything got wet when we took showers. no curtain??? the bathroom was neat but tiny. just a sink, mirror, and toilet. We walked all over from this hotel. had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Pokey rooms, but right location”
Reviews.Author: LeatherFoot
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures on the hotel web site or in the lobby. The rooms are generally small unless you book directly with the hotel as ask for a specific one. Try the second floor as they have balconys and tables overlooking the street scene. The room we had didn't have any proper light fixtures, just wires poking out of the wall with light bulbs attached. It seems to me that if you book with one of the online travel companies, you won't get a good room. We booked at Hotels and paid for a superior room. If superior means lights hanging on wires I dare not consider what a standard room is! The bathrooms are OK and in general the place is fairly clean and the rooms quiet. This is important if you want to be right in the Latin quarter as it gets pretty noisy outside with all the people, restaraunts and traffic. The room had A/C but didn't work too well, especially when it was hot, but better than nothing. Breakfast at 10 euros is a bit steep for what you get. Go to a local bakery, and Starbucks up the road and save a bundle. Location is great, walk to Notre Dame, Pompideau Center and all the sights around the Quarter. There are a couple of Metros close by, and an easy trip to all the other sites in Paris and much cheaper and quicker than taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: greecube
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon the reviews read here, as I was looking for a nice hotel room, not too expensive, in a good location, and which could fit 3 comfortably. I can say, after spending 4 nights at Hotel Eurpoe St Severin, that the reviews are accurate: I booked a triple room for me, the wife and our 10 year old son. The room faced the inner courtyard and was very quiet, not small but not too big either for a triple (2 single beds and a sofa/sleeper). But it offered zero privacy, so the next night we rented a double at single occupancy price for the kid (this room was very small but the bathroom was roomy, go figure). He really enjoyed it, but it may be cramp for 2 adults. Overall, the place "felt" like a budget hotel. Nothing fancy, and I was not disappointed in our choice. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, since there are so many places nearby with better fare. We did eat dinner at the rerstaurant, and it was very good and relatively inexpensive. Of course, the location was great, being steps from the Metro/RER, bus lines, and close to Notre Dame. We attended the high mass on Sunday at the St Severin Church, just around the corner, which turned out to be one of the highlights of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the hotel Europe Saint Severin during a quick weekend trip to Paris. These are the main advantages: - Located just a few blocks from the Notre Dame, we walked to all sights in Paris. - Located in cosy pedestrian area with lots of restaurants and creperies. - Very convenient and close to the RER station St Michel (train to/from Charles du Gaulle airport) - Friendly staff - Clean bathroom and sheets, but the carpet... I don't want to know. However, there were also some disadvantages: - Very small room (103) (but we didn't spend that much time in it anyway) - There seems to be some renovation going on, and our room could need it. Also the hallway shows a lot of wear and tear. - Noise from the street below didn't stop until four in the morning, I guess that's what can be expected in that area. On the other hand, it gave a true parisian feel. - Our toilet seat was cracked, but was replaced after the first night. I think I will try another hotel next time in Paris. This hotel was OK, but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mierman1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Saint Severin. The room is small but the location was perfect and very convienent from the airport Metro line. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you plan on spending alot of time in the room, you might not care for it but if you want to get around town easily and enjoy the city, St. Severin will be good for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss hotel-we missed”
Reviews.Author: GGG1228
Reviews.Content: I know that Paris hotel rooms are small but our room was small even for Paris standards. We had no place to put our suitcases and could barely walk around our bed (and we are not large people). We wish they would have left out the TV stand and given us the extra room instead. The room was dark even with all the lights on. We much preferred the Parc Saint Severin that is about a block away. I noticed a map of the hotel rooms for our floor on the inside of our door. It looked like a jigsaw puzzle. Some of the rooms were much larger than ours. I guess we just got an unlucky draw. The restaurants in the area are decent but not great. If you're looking for fine dining, this is not the place. However, if you want to have the option of getting a dark chocolate gelato or a nutella crape at midnight, this is the area for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conveniently situated for Notre Dame and River Seine. On arrival by RER from Charles de Gaulle we couldn't believe how near the Metro was, and how easy the hotel was to find. I would highly recommend this 'cosy' hotel with 'Allo 'Allo style restaurant/bar. The food and service in the restaurant was excellent!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Europe Saint Severin
HotelInfo.Address: 38-40, rue Saint Severin, 75005 Paris, France
